oJf_ZX1Rdc8HC5TaO7a9UA.text: We live around the corner and had heard mixed reviews and decided to judge for ourselves.  The setup is appealing to my inner southern tendencies/roots (christmas light canopy/rustic cheque ). Ordered the pizza and was underwhelmed. Don't get me wrong - I ate some of it- but factored in having had to skip lunch due to work obligations. I was at the point were stale bread would have tasted like truffle butter.  Service was very pleasant and attentive without being obnoxious (unlike the hipsters two deep...*sigh* to be young and blissfully ignorant)

aO_Y0mEeYWkAeNLvSVJo-g.text: Social is a good restaurant.   I would say the beer list is worthy of 4-stars (although sometimes they run out of the items on their menu).  I'm also a fan of the pierogi pizza and homemade ice cream sandwiches for dessert. And the salads are quite large so be forewarned.    Servers are also worthy of 4-stars, with timely and informed service, able to make good recommendations about food and beer. The server last night immediately brought drinks for the kids and had recommendations for us with the beer list.   The reason for the 3-star rating is the length of time its taken on a few occasions for the food to come out. With a family of 4, this can really be a problem when the kids start to get hungry.  For example, last night it took 20 minutes (possibly 25) for the food to come out. Which is just too long.

FWH9PXVEVlFEQbnY42WwSg.text: Pros: service and environment (kinda)  cons: food is pretty boring/bad.  I wouldn't go back here unless I was in the area and starving.

jCIdaOO2bZ_1ynvZ1aRdhg.text: I've been going to Social once to twice a week for almost 2 years now. Trivia on Monday nights can be hard to hear but is always fun. Just know that of there is a major sporting event it will either start early or be canceled. The addition of a ping pong table and fooseball table on the porch are a fun touch. As for the food and drinks, the happy hour specials are excellent, though the food options change with the seasons. The food is pretty good but pretty standard. The tots are delicious thiugh, just make sure you ask for extra "awesome sauce"!

O1nyYGqufoqmjFiIe2bqxw.text: I was really excited when this place opened, but my excitement quickly faded once I dined there. The portion sizes are the size you would expect for a "small plates" dish and while the food was not bad, it was not good enough to command the price of tapas. My old fashioned was equally miniature. After we finished our food and first drinks, I was tempted to order another round of EVERYTHING (both food and drink) but decided that was quite socially acceptable since the dishes were not supposed to be small plates. We ended up just getting more drinks and leaving hungry.  Our waitress was overly nice, almost to the point of annoyance, but I guess that is better than the opposite. The patio is Social's one redeeming factor, but since it is almost winter I will have no reason to go back any time soon.

hGGboi1xk0uAbCTUQRRgQQ.text: All I have to say about this place is get the veggie burger.  It's so good!  Order it without cheese and aioli and it's AMAZING and vegan.  What? Yes!  We were in such disbelief that the burger was vegan that we had the server ask the chef to verify that it was in fact vegan.  This place is a little pricey but it's cute and new.  I liked the decor which was open, airy, clean, and inviting.  If I worked closer to here I would make this the place to go with coworkers for happy hour.  Also like that this place is open late so I can get the veggie burger when I get a craving later in the night.

7jLfDdMhzdyO-oaHT7fH3g.text: I had brunch here and it was OK. The portion was a descent size and the taste was fine. I think it was a little salty for me which means for a normal person veryyyy salty.

RL6Q8nqgU4vg29B-6hvqGA.text: The food was just ok, chorizo nachos. Beer selection was decent. Place wasn't very clean and  had a strong beer smell.

R04hAQuiFz16QzCZRVguFw.text: Fantastic location and great hours. Food is very good and the beer list is excellent. They also do takeout, with that I recommend the Thai Chicken pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Thai Chicken pizza.

nU8ZRONQE7QTAlmJGCyI0w.text: very pleasant atmosphere. good menu. enjoyed the cuban sandwich. was there to catch up with a friend i havent seen in forever and didnt want to be rushed. our server Nina was a rockstar, attentive without rushing us and a great personality. will come back any time i'm in the area.

JBJAR40k3LsVPqfrzMh_Sw.text: We had several dishes. Almost everything was burned...not overcooked, BURNED. We had the city chicken appetizer. The outside was VERY dark brown, inside was as dry as could be. The flavors were there, you just could not recognize them anymore.It came with "honey mustard dip", which was pure vinegar. You can get MUCH better honey mustard out of a squeeze container. We ordered the GCBLT...the bacon was inedible. It was totally burned and gave a bad flavor to the whole sandwich. The chicken was overcooked and dry. While all of the food was hot (appreciated), the tots were ice cold. This is supposed to be something special from them. The fruit salad had either been frozen or sat for many hours (or both). It was soft and slimy. On the plus side...the cauliflower patties were outstanding. The Cuban sandwich was good. The ham and cheese sandwich was acceptable. This will be the ABSOLUTE last time we make this MISTAKE!

9lXdJmqdNPdGIBP_1IPOkw.text: The interior is nice and I like that they have outside seating for the summer, but the food, drinks and service can use a little work. We had Moscow Mules that were on a drink list, but were served in rocks glass and didn't taste like ginger beer at all... Maybe it went flat, maybe they ran out of mugs, but if you put this drink on the menu, you should be able to serve it the right way... Tried switching to beer, but our server didn't know anything about it... He was just keep saying he didn't try it yet, so he is not sure what kind they are... If it wasn't for the great location, I don't think it will be doing so well...

zxywwduzPnqhhtG6289TVA.text: Good, casual menu. The space is cool too. I recommend the southwest salad with the jalapeno lime dressing. Ask your server for some warm tortilla wraps and make yourself fish tacos with the salad. That's next level stuff.

VFMEVdGIBEOOOcvgE198hA.text: Underwhelming, if you're coming for the food. If you're just here for drinks, I'm sure this is a much better place.  I came for lunch, and ordered the soup du jour and a side salad. Kind of hard to mess up, right? The salad was supposed to be a caesar salad, but had the barest essence of dressing, pretty much non existent cheese, and the lettuce was wilted. As in, floppy limp whythehellwouldyouservethis wilted. Whatever, it was a side salad, and I get it. Who cares about side salads. It's not like you're charging $4 for stuff you probably wouldn't feed your own kid. Oh, but there were a few giant croutons. Guess that's what made it a caesar salad. Maybe I was just disappointed because for a place that has a "build your own salad" option, I wouldn't have thought that a side salad would have been so disappointing.  The soup was "baked potato" soup, which was really just creamy potato with some bacon and sour cream. I'm not sure what I was expecting, come to think of it, so I'm not going to give them a hard time about this one, but it wasn't anything I would come back for.  My friend had the veggie burger, which came with a whole bunch of tater tots. Now, I haven't had tater tots since elementary school, so I actually give them props for appealing to my retro side. She said the burger was very good.   The service was fine, and it's got a nice informal atmosphere that I am sure makes it the perfect place for happy hour. But as a person who doesn't much drink... this place is not impressive at all.

E8GqtmzeGPBzlyTkdQ39Cg.text: I have been to Social several times and I always get the same thing...so this review is about how great I think the Social environment is, but ALSO about how completely delicious I think the Grilled Shrimp Salad!!  I wish that I could rave about all of the delightful menu items but I cant.  This shrimp salad has spinach, peas, orzo, feta cheese, and kale (my fav).  I always go with the lemon basil vinaigrette that the menu suggests because it is the BEST for this salad.  The lemon in the dressing gives the salad a nice kick to an otherwise mild mannered albeit delicious salad.  If you are a salad lover I suggest Social and the Grilled Shrimp Salad.  Hopefully I will break from my comfort zone and try other salads on the menu.  If I do, I will tell YELP first :)  note* The staff at Social have always been kind and attentive which is a HUGE Plus in my book!

xmh9SyafqXscwHeRySot5w.text: Decent ambiance.  Not a super foodie place.    However, the gluten free pizza was really quite good, so we will likely return, especially for the great outdoor seating and happy hour specials.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gluten free roasted cauliflower pizza.  Nice crust!
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

UJeyggTvvqldceDsV34PiQ.text: Brand new, but lacking luster.    The descriptions on the menu belie the actual appetizers and entrees.  This "gastropub" was suggested to me for happy hour by a colleague.  At first appearances the menu suggests interesting twists on standard pub fair, but don't be fooled.  I ordered the "dewedged" salad that claims pancetta as an ingredient.  What actually appeared on my plate was cold chewy bacon bits.  The consensus at the table was that the food fell far short of what was touted by the waitress as being made predominantly in-house.  There's a caveat to the $2 can Tuesday happy hour: It only applies to beers $4.50 and under.  Sadly, the beer selection is limited generally.  The beer selection priced at $4.50 and under forces you to choose from run-of-the-mill beers like Red Stripe, Blue Moon, and Yuengling.  I had a better experience at Industry Public House in Lawrenceville.

P3MAtmy92OslIuz4JTwBpA.text: I had been wanting to go to this place for a while, and finally got to go last weekend. I remeber when they first opened they had some Google (it's located in Bakery Square right below Google) shin-dig and the food looked really good. It has an outside seating area but the when we were there it was raining so they covered the outdoor area with an awning thingy. I rather enjoyed the sound of the rain pelting the plastic awning, but, I'm a weirdo, so...  The menu is a lot of the norm- salads, sandwichs, pizzas- but with a kind of flare. For example, I got some sort of western salad with corn and black beans but it had mahi mahi on it. SO GOOD! The mahi mahi was delicious and cooked to perfection! Even was boyfriend who thinks everything is so-so declared it was fantastic!  And they have delicious, unique dressings like bacon bistro and chipotle lime. Very good! A lot of the sandwiches have unique, unusal ingredients that shake things up as well.   My BF and I ended up spliting a pizza and the salad. Like I said, the salad was amazing and the pizza was close behind. Because I picked the salad he picked the pizza and chose a buffalo chicken with blue cheese. Now, being a bread lover I always try the crust first. Having a good or bad crust strongly influences how I feel about a pizza. It was pretty good. Not too thin or thick with a nice wood fire oven taste even tough I don't  think it actually is cooked that way.   Now, like I said, it was buffalo chicken, which I like, but I'm not a huge fan of blue cheese and this cheese was, I was told, a strong, aged blue cheese. Way too strong for my weak palate. Other than that the pizza itself was good with a tasty buffalo sauce and lots of chicken.   Overall I really liked it. Food is definitley about average for a casual joint and the atmosphere is pretty cool too.

pYWIHRUBRSfsGDWDPDlLfQ.text: Stopped by here on my way back from Trader Joes. The service was great. We didn't have to wait too long for our food which is a plus. It was as little too dark for me, I could barely read the menu and so did the family next to me, we had to use the flashlight on our iPhones. The food was cooked perfectly and served piping hot which I loved. But the burger (social burger) and fries were very salty, I couldn't finish my meal because my body was complaining. Don't order the Social burger if you suffer from high blood pressure aka hypertension because you might have a heart attack.  Overall a good place to go with reasonable prices.

EMzeInbVs3e4ms_4qYh25A.text: My last experience was awful.  There are always good drink options, however the service I experienced last night was awful.    Social has an option to create your own salad which my girlfriend and I both did.  We ended up being served the incorrect meal twice and on the third try, just sucked it up and ate it.  The waitress was extremely rude and as she served our food told us "As I told you we're out of x, y and x".  Actually, we had been informed that many other items we tried to order were unavailable (only to see them served to other customers and accidentally ourselves).  She then refused to return to our table.  We had to ask to speak to a manager 3 times before he was able to stop by our table, only to realize, he'd been working near us for the past 30 minutes.  He also could care less about the situation.  He was kind enough to offer a discount on the bill, but what we really wanted was an apology or assurance that this behavior is not acceptable.  All in all, it was OK food and horrible service.  Part of the dining experience and cost is service.  We won't be returning to pay to be treated poorly.

vf76dCaR1S6pStsR2YMY2g.text: I keep thinking about the delicious turkey burger I had here. That's when you know you had a good meal! All I want to do is go back and get another. And another. And another! My friends, it's the best turkey burger I've ever had!  But the thing is, it was good on all levels. The smoked gouda, lettuce, tomato and mango ketchup made it a dream. And let me tell you, I usually have to douse my burgers with condiments, but everything was the perfect amount. And the bun was awesome. I believe it was a potato bun, but whatever it was, it was a really good bun:)  I also ordered tots, which were good and crispy... but that burger just shined! Oh yeah, there was also some good ahi tuna nachos too. They were really good actually, but... you know what I'm gonna say... the burger was the best! But just so you know, the nachos are not necessarily nachos, but one singular chip with ahi tuna and gauc on top. They're a small portion, but a good starter.  I also like the fun atmosphere. It's really just all about being social. I like the wide open feel. So even though I was there for lunch, I'm definitely going back for a happy hour or late night with friends. Definitely a very strong start for this new joint!

Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Turkey Burger and Tots

js8tFDRUpihfDLQ4RAQMKA.text: Nothing to write home about. Food was average. Got the falafel (weird flavor, not like the falafels I usually have), Cuban sandwich (again, average) and the reuben fritters. Wasn't crazy about those and let the rest of my party eat it.   Probably wouldn't go back again unless with a group of friends to grab a drink.

PDnpF-oT_G2WKsA5WIZBVg.text: A friend and I came here since she had a $10 gift certificate. We shared the Argentinian steak salad and chicken & waffles sandwich.   The salad itself was ok but the steak was very tough and chewy. Some pieces were so tough that I had to spit it out.   The chicken on the chicken & waffle sandwich was pretty good but the waffles were so oily and hard. Do they fry the waffles? Not sure but definitely felt like they do! I just took out the chicken and ate it by itself. I couldn't even finish my half of the sandwich. Neither did my friend.

qtRMLg1yRvRBqTz6-XsatA.text: Finally made it over here for a friends birthday get-together, which is to say we probably won't be back.  My first impression as we grabbed a drink menu from the bar is that I wasn't sure what the theme was of the place. Was it a beer joint? Not really. Was it open seating? No. I'm still not really sure.  Their drink menu is decent, and they have several low price options which was good to see. They were pretty busy though and there were long stretches of time where no one was behind the bar. This meant we had quite a wait for drink #1.  Our group congregated by the dart boards as we didn't want to wait for a large table. Once we caught a waiter dropping off some food we asked if the two of us (my wife and I) could order some food and initially he didn't want to take our order. And when he did, he wasn't very pleasant about it.  Now to the food. We had wings and pizza because that's what we saw most people eating. The pizza itself was great - we had the margarita pie with an incredibly sweet chunky sauce and a nice crispy dough. The wings were supposed to be jerk wings but they didn't have much flavor, mostly were just coated with a dry seasoning which certainly isn't jerk.  If you do go, get the pizza, but otherwise this joint did less than impress.

mAU-w7tTqYWcSlxgw70f2g.text: Wow. Another 5 star review. Can I help it that PGH has some awesome places to go out and eat?  Went here for lunch with my wife today - we had it on our list since the Yelp Geeks Out party, where we enjoyed a sampling of some of their appetizers. Rachel had also written a lot of great things about the place, so we decided to check it out - so glad we did!  It's great to see a new place packed... PACKED for lunch. We were politely told by the hostess that we would have to wait for a table, but could sit at the bar and order if we wanted to. Once again, glad we did! The bartender was friendly, efficient, and attentive. He certainly was skilled at making a whole variety of interesting drinks for the patrons while we were deciding on our order.  We decided to try their shrimp 'tacos' (the taco shell is actually a rather tasty wonton, much like their tuna 'nachos') and a beet salad and shrimp salad. Awesome. The grilled shrimp were pretty much the tastiest shrimp I've ever had. Anywhere. The goat cheese and beet salad was tasty and filling, and the nice part was that both salads came with the dressing on the side, so you can dial it in or out as you see fit.  Prices are reasonable, and overall, this looks like a great place to have lunch or meet up with friends to watch a game or two. Will definitely be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled shrimp salad
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beet salad
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mmmmm! Shrimp &#34;tacos&#34;

TC4RXanH-FP4hab7NXUzlA.text: The menu has a fairly diverse selection, prices are fair as is the selection on tap. It's a fun place to stop in for a few or for lunch. I like their pizza and salads best, the grilled cheese isn't too shabby either.

9Qn7PY6kK6BCxLq-1-XcBg.text: I visited Social with a friend, and we were both excited to try this place we had heard so much about! I live really close by, so it's a shame I hadn't tried it yet. I noticed right away that while there were vegetarian options, not many of them were remotely healthy or unique, which was a little disappointing. I went for the quesadilla with black beans and some kind of avocado cream. My friend ordered soup and a sandwich, and we shared fries.  The service at around 4pm on a Saturday was not extraordinary, but they weren't rude either. It was just slow during a slow period. The servers were knowledgeable and helpful, so they get points back there!   My food was good. Just good. Nothing really stood out, it wasn't a super memorable meal. More memorable to me is the environment that Social has, which is pretty casual and comfortable.   I hope to go back and try a few other things, but I don't find myself jumping at the opportunity even though it's one of the closest restaurants to my apartment and reasonably priced. I'd really like to see them offer more interesting options for vegetarians too, which is a big selling point for me.

v9r0V0EH4z8lu1n08eMxsQ.text: Went for lunch. I had the Runs House salad. It was just ok. The tomatoes and cucumbers were diced really small and the chicken fingers on top needed to be cooked a bit longer. As salads go, it was mediocre.   Had a few of my buddy's fries which were amazing. He got the steak sandwich and said it was really good, although not as big as you would expect it to be for the price. A few folks at surrounding tables had pizzas that looked great. The service was fine. If I go back I'll get a pizza or sandwich and steer clear of the salads.

Sn27A4qewHRNUW_QjA68nA.text: Had to make a trip to Target, so we stopped by Social for lunch first. They have outdoor seating but it was drizzling out, so we opted for indoors. We were brought to a table by the window and got to reap the benefit of natural lighting. Boyfriend chose the Eggs in Hell from the brunch menu and liked it (but wished it came with more than one small stainless steel sauce cup of tots). I got the Social burger (rare, minus tomatoes) from the normal menu. This was the rarest burger I've ever consumed (see photo; so much red if the picture does it justice), which is not a bad thing at all! I enjoyed the rareness quite a bit. It was so rare that it didn't taste much like meat--more like cheese or mashed potatoes? I don't know if they always make their rare burgers like that, but that's how mine was. Yum. The Social sauce was a nice finishing touch too. The main problem I had with the burger was that it was too salty, but luckily it didn't ruin the whole experience. The fries that it came with were good. They have multiple TV screens in the dining area, so that's a distraction for you if you're with boring company (not that I was :P). With great prices, friendly staff, and a casual atmosphere, this place is good for a brunch or lunch with friends.   Taste | 3.5 Atmosphere | 3 Presentation | 3.5 Service | 3.5 OVERALL | 3.5

qdvxzG-et1ANWJp5gIE0ww.text: Love love love this place! It's become our go-to. Pizza is the best I've had in my life & they're HUGE. Drinks are outstanding & reasonable. Kid & dog friendly. Outdoor area is wonderful. It's in Bakery Square which has PLENTY of parking & it's free if you're just going for a few hours. We enjoy spending time shopping as a family then finishing at Social with drinks & a pizza. Laid back & relaxing. Staff is always friendly & attentive.

-vbDg5M9dgt4HsK1-Ll3xA.text: This is a revised review.  I continue to have a love/hate relationship with this Bar, so I will attempt to be objective with this review.  The Ups: 1. It's the closest and only bar within walking distance of my house 2. I run into nice random people here all the time.  3. They rotate their drafts regularly 4. Free Wi-fi so I can watch my movie homework at the Bar 5. Roomie event space for groups 6. Outdoor seating  The Downs: 1. Overpriced Canned Beers 2. The original opening menu has been revised and they took off my favorite Caesar Salad [it came with awesome strips of anchovies] 3. There is an imbalance in staffing [more about this later] 4. You are oft forgotten by the Bartending staff because they know you come to hang out 5. Will give another try but the mixed drinks are awful 6. The food is hit or miss even if you continue to order the same thing [the attempt to substitute Kale for Spinach was a fail, the jerk wings vary in spicing and the meatball sliders have an overly intense seasoning]  The improved: 1. The Bartending skills and attentiveness has improved since they opened [between replacing the bar or training them to be better]  The latest: The reason I knocked the rating down to 2 stars rather than a more appropriate three or 4 is and remains the service. Personally, I am an efficiency freak [duh - CMU ops]. So I cannot help but comment on last Sunday's experience:  I visited on a Sunday at around 4:30pm so it must have been right when shifts were switching. The place was fairly empty as there were no sports games on TV and it was pretty cold outside, but that did not stop them from having 2 bartenders, the regular hostess and not 1, 2 but 4 waitresses on staff. Of these 4, only 1 of them was actually hustling and working. The remainder were BS-ing at the Bar with what I presumed to be the owner [recalling from memory once being introduced at the beginning of Social's existence] and it was almost unidentifiable whether their shifts were over or not. If they were on, you gained a sense of abandonment as a customer, who would routinely look around for refills on beers, if you were off shift, take off your aprons! Now I understand about giving your boss attention but still.  Same with the Bartenders, my regularly seen bartender would drift back and forth between the kitchen and within the Bar, however ignored my need to refill by Beer. It took a while to catch the attention of the second one, who stared at my 15% full glass and never bothered to ask if I wanted a refill. Now, I was doing homework, however I would have enjoyed my black and white movie more with an additional dark beer or two.  Naturally, will continue to come back from the given "Ups" listing above. But I seriously hope they smooth out their regular experiences.

Kb6j3xb10mvmkNitYrX6fw.text: I visited last night at around 6:45.  Because I was meeting CM here at 7, I decided to sit at the bar and take advantage of happy hour.  I was impressed by the long list of $2 beers, which included Woodchuck Amber hard cider, which I ordered.  Happy hour here seems quite popular--the bar was almost full at the time that I arrived, and was completely full by the time CM arrived--and given the selection and discount, I can certainly understand the attraction!  Once CM arrived, we got a table.  Having heard good things about the fried cauliflower patties, we decided to get an order of them to share.  (This worked out nicely, since one order comprises 4 patties.)  They were quite nice, esp. with the lemon aioli sauce drizzled on them, tasting similar to potato patties.  Cauliflower patties aren't an item that would normally hold a huge appeal to me, but I'd definitely recommend them!  For my entree, I ordered the turkey burger, since I'd also heard good things about it, and CM ordered the Social (beef) burger.  Based on other reviews, I was expecting a mind-blowingly delicious turkey burger.  Alas, this was not the case.  Paradoxically, the turkey patty and bun were extremely dry, whereas the toppings were overly moist.  As I ate the burger, the far end became soggier and soggier, to the point that I found it inedible, only finishing 2/3 of it.  The burger wasn't nearly as flavorful as I was hoping, either--I could barely taste the gouda cheese, and the lettuce and tomatoes didn't add much to it in terms of flavor, either.  In general, the ingredients struck me as low quality.  I ordered the cheesy tomato soup as a side, and it wasn't bad--it was thicker and creamier than Campbell's, though it wasn't quite as cheesy as I would have hoped, and I'm not sure how I feel about the toasted bready thing floating in it.  The burgers came with fresh cut fries, which was a nice touch, but they were nothing too special.  Aside from the food, service was pretty lackluster, with our waitress making minimal conversation, etc.--although she did keep our water glasses filled, which we appreciated.  As for the ambiance, I'd describe it as rather loud and somewhat boisterous--which I suppose is to be expected for a place called Social.  People were engaging in some fun activities, such as ping pong and darts, which was cool to watch.  Overall, with the exception of the cauliflower patties, I wasn't very impressed with the food at Social.  (I found out later that Social is owned by the same group that owns Shady Grove, for which I have similar feelings.)  If you want a solid turkey burger, I'd recommend checking out BRGR nearby. I'd consider returning for happy hour, but would definitely go elsewhere for dinner.

Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tomato soup w/ cheese
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cauliflower patty

11fbaCCrtWH_WJomS6ybJA.text: My husband and I came here for impromptu brunch a few Sundays ago. It was later in the day around 1ish so it wasn't very crowded, however we got to sit next a meeting of the backwards hat club. Sorry, a personal pet peeve I HATE IT when men wear baseball hats in restaurants. Sure, yeah it was a Sunday brunch and I'm sure they partied hard the night before and it's not like Social is a "fancy schmany" place, but come one guys, take a freakin shower and comb your hair.    Okay, personal rant over. Anyway, my husband(who was NOT wearing a hat) ordered the corned beef hash and eggs and we were both impressed with that dish. I was lame and got a salad, but it was a well-sized portion and came with pickled eggs(!!!) which I love and was very pleasantly surprised by. I also ordered a virgin bloodie as I am currently expectin g and unfortunately we got charged the full price for a Bloody Mary and alcohol tax even though it didn't have any vodka and my husband just got coffee. We didn't make a big deal about it at the time, tax was only 28 cents. But, in future will definitely ask/follow-up on being charged for booze here and at other locations. Lesson learned.  I'm only giving this 3 starts for now, am interested in coming back for dinner and taking advantage of their on-tap beer selection once I have this baby.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A virgin bloodie

ONQJjAeEgOnK3SRIiOyXog.text: I hadn't been to social in a while, but I like it much better now. The gluten-free pizza is amazing, and I love me some tater tots! I still refuse to order a salad because after you order the toppings you want, it's way too expensive.  The kale dip was a little heavy and salty for my tastes, but it wasn't bad.   The staff is very friendly, and the atmosphere is relaxing and enjoyable.

7uambbg5aZ1TYiMHTveo1A.text: Stopped by social for a couple drinks with a friend. I'm not sure what I expected, but it wasn't this. It's fine. Very stripped-down minimalist decor, drinks were fine.   It seems like every place in Pittsburgh serves mules now, and I love them, but Social serves theirs in a regular drink glass as opposed to a copper mug.  Meh.   Fine to use as an after work meeting place, but more of a transition place then a final destination.

D46ZhzHtZHPyVC9shApExg.text: Very fast service, decent prices and you can bring your dog ! Very neat restaurant with a well spread variety of beer selection. The food they serve is average American with slight twists. Social also has a very wide range of gluten-free options. Overall good experience.

Ah1fPfb-ufRoVnqHaA4kUA.text: I like Social! I've been there quite a few times and every time I've visited the quality of the food and service has been pretty consistent and solid.   I have been satisfied with every visit to Social. I remember one time when I went to Social for drinks with a friend, I asked the waiter what beer from the draft list he recommended (The Great Lakes Nosferatu sp?) and I ended up ordering the beer and LOVING it. When I last visited, the service was extremely quick, friendly, and efficient.   As for the food, I really like their pizzas and their grilled cheese sandwiches with tomato soup. However, if you end up ordering the grilled cheese, the portions are smaller for that dish so it's possible to be not quite full from that dish. Overall, great restaurant with really good food and a solid draft list!

AWfp6emXm8_rQYzjntZ9ZA.text: So I really like this place, mainly because of the close proximity to my place, the good drink specials, as well as the trivia that takes place on most Mondays at 7pm.  I have tried a few of their appetizers, the tuna wrap appetizer is pretty awesome as well as hummus is pretty standard, the veggie dip, which was good, as well as the coli-flower patties which in my opinion are pretty excellent - love that sauce they use!!  In terms of their main dishes I love the Argentinian salad. This is really my go to dish when I am here. They use field greens, sauteed portobello mushrooms, I opt for medium rare steak, blue cheese, onions, and tomatoes all topped by a fried egg with some chimichurri dressing on the side, which is pretty spot on.   I have had a slice of their buffalo chicken pizza and their BBQ chicken pizza, which was pretty tasty as well. I especially like the fact that their crust is fairly thin.   In terms of service it is pretty good and have had no real complaints. Overall, this place is pretty solid and as long as their trivia and drink specials exist and they don't tweak their Argentinian salad, I will be coming back.

WbF51-rfaqY2h1YkHyrkIg.text: Started off no with no service.  The waiter finally came over and waited on the table next to us who sat down after us, mind you a waitress walked by our table twice, no acknowledgment.  So we sat at the bar, at that point the waiter said sorry.  The wait staff acts like they are doing you a favor waiting on you.  I love french toast and tried theirs, no flavor, ordinary syrup, nothing special. My mom had the ruben fritters and loved them.  Won't be back with all the choices out there.

QjUTft5fjxFshGIGy7FzeQ.text: They have a wide selection of beer and their food is good. I love that they have make your own salads. The flatbreads are really good as well.

NiuieL2N20pRU8sW6vWEkQ.text: The worst service I've ever experienced.  Upon arrival, the manager acting as the host did not offer us the option to sit in their patio area and seated us at a high top table in the middle of the bar on a gorgeous Sunday afternoon. Our server, Erin, introduced herself and brought us drinks and that was about all that she did during our meal.  After waiting about 45 minutes for our breakfast pizza and mushroom spinach scramble, I asked the manager who was walking by if he could please check on our food. In the meantime, our server did not stop at our table once. Other couples seated in our section that arrived after us had their meals come out and Erin refilled their waters and checked in with them all the while walking past us and not even glancing in our direction. The manager came back to tell us there was a large party ahead of us and we were about 2 tickets away. He refilled our coffee and was apologetic for the wait. After another 15 minutes, our food arrived. The breakfast pizza was extremely hot. The scramble was a mess and clearly made in haste, the "toast" was soggy bread not even toasted, and the tots were cold. The server finally came by after the manager had already gotten us butter and Sriracha and mumbled an apology about the wait and asked if we needed anything for the first time in an hour. My meal was inedible and after waiting an hour we got a few apologies and $2.70 knocked off our bill. As an experienced server myself, this was completely unacceptable service and management. Will not return ever again. Steer clear!!

p2cYpxiE_hhwg4MgS97USQ.text: Never order the Wings ! Tiny, tiny tiny Wings. Small order for $6 for 6 of the smallest restaurant wings I have ever had. Came in basket without even a couple of pieces of celery or carrots for Presentation/Color. Didn't add any dipping sauce. Not sure how much extra. Dry Rub was OK, but a little salty.

m-TYS72Y6njg7kiYVPsrcA.text: Mediocre food, cold cavernous room, loud, way too expensive for what you get (quality and taste of the food is a notch below Eat N' Park, for example).  It's a shame because the location is great and their staff is wonderful.

xxyx2xkKrXfudlgXmBP49g.text: The cauliflower cakes are awesome. Crispy outside with a soft tasty inside. Served with an aioli sauce that compliments them very well. Also had some wings that were very crispy and seasoned to perfection. The sauce was served on the side which was a nice touch. The wings were spiced enough to stand alone on their own and the sauce was a nice compliment.

BiH2X96DN7V7lfZgsUxILg.text: I always ride past Social it usually has a large crowd .I read some good reviews and decided to try it . I was with a group of 8 people . They have a Groups of 6 or more gratuities are included policy . Which was very apparent because our waitress was awful . It was a Sunday afternoon not at all crowded she was just prancing around the room  she would show up then leave and not come back for what seems like forever she wouldn't even look our way .. We had 2 kids under 4 yrs old she never acknowledged them. at one point someone in our group had to get up and go get her . Other times we had to yell and wave across the restaurant for her attention . Before we knew her tip was included everyone was talking about this horrible service . Then it all made since she already had her tip included in the bill and she wasn't willing to work or put in effort for more . I work in the service industry . I actually work in a first class setting and she is everything a waitress shouldn't be . I let her know on my way out the door how her service was and she said Oh sorry you can fill out a comment card . Now to the food . One person in the group said it doesn't smell like any food is cooking and when we got our food it didn't taste like it either . I ordered the jerk wings . The jerk wings are not JERK . They were beyond crispy that chicken was over by about 5 min. The jerk wings are hook n fish wing dings with a chili dipping sauce on the side . Jerk requires a marinade of unbelievable spices I really want then to change the name some of my Jamaican friends would be appalled . The pizza was tasteless though it had a nice thin crust which I like but still no flavor . The Thai Shrimp tacos looked great but were ice cold and had no flavor . My sister had a $12 glass of Pinot Grigio which is a complete rip off  ..she didn't look at price before ordering she said oops .my drink Sangria with fresh fruit taste like raspberry lemonade no trace of alcohol.. The buffalo chicken pizza had to be sent back because of the huge globs of bleu cheese that overwhelmed the pizza  ..Like I said I'm a foodie also a cook with a excellent palate I won't be back . Nor would I recommend this to anyone ..Ugh

C5e4Xcv3yoYB5P4IyC3FxQ.text: Food: On point and HUGE serving! I ordered a build-your-own salad. My boyfriend enjoyed his sandwich. So we definitely got this place on a good day. Hmm for others it could be a hit or miss. Ya never know.  Drinks: There are several mimosa choices. I ended up with grapefruit mimosa. Yummy!  Service: Not too shabby. Our party sat outside. Our server seemed busy and did forget couple basic things but it happens. Although, later throughout the night it was odd. They have a "bouncer" who is poorly dressed and checks ids by the entrance. To make the place more welcoming, give him some kind of uniform...like a black polo shirt or something.  Then the guest became a little too drunk, a little too quick...which became humorous.   All in all, the place isn't too bad and I wouldn't mind coming back for the food and drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mimosas saturday specials
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nachos

_8jo5NBrPiP7RqT_2c0LZw.text: I've been to Social a few times now, service can usually be a little slow but yesterday the service was great! We had the Falafel and Hot Hog Sandwich which were both really good. Their beers are pricey but they usually have decent drinks specials which makes it more reasonable. We sat outside and had our dog with us. They brought water for the dog and even have a little menu of food for dogs that includes doggie ice cream, pigs ear etc....which was really cute.

xkftKe1RZY8xutG0nx-DQQ.text: Where do I begin?   4 starters....the atmosphere was lively. Uptempo, bubbly, and fun. It's located at the forefront of Bakery Square on the Eastside (East Liberty) of Pittsburgh.   The staff was friendly and accommodating...I was seated and serviced quickly by Caitlyn, who by the way was super friendly and helpful.   I had my taste buds set and fixed on the "Steak" burger, unfortunately it was so good that it was sold out. I then shifted and ordered the "Social" burger...at first bite I was sold.   It was seasoned and cooked to sheer perfection. The fries it was served with will quickly remind your of the potato patch fries from Kennywood. (you know what I mean if your from the Burgh) only they were much better....so that says ALOT!   Social also has a bar with ample seating and tv viewing from all angles. The outdoor seating is great too.   Because I couldn't get the burger I originally wanted I gave a rating of 4 stars vs 5, however it was a 5 star experience all the way and a nice setup for me to return!   Great job Social! I'll certainly be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The &#34;Social&#34; burger and fries
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The atmosphere and entrance

9ciwOZNXRq33BQIG-chuyg.text: Came here for late dinner with family and was unimpressed unfortunately. Service was sub par and the food was even worse. My brother and I had the Buffalo 2.0 Pizza and we could not even finish a single slice because it was repulsive. The chicken tasted like it was a week old, the buffalo sauce didn't taste right, and there was way too much cheese. I had high hopes for this but was let down. I do not recommend this restaurant.

F5aWWssR5x4zc9vm62cBNw.text: Well, hmmmm.  There's the good and the bad. 1.  Good - Kitchen open later on weeknights than surrounding restaurants (11pm). 2.  Bad - I had the mushroom Panini and my partner the shrimp po' boy.  Eh.  I don't think the Panini was on actual Panini bread (seemed like just the bread ends or something) and the shrimp on the po' boy looked pretty dull and unappetizing. 3.  Good - French fries.  Done right, and fresh cut.  Dipped in ranch, which is the "yummy" ranch, very tasty. 4.  Bad - Loud, with dated music.  Maybe they're pandering to a certain generation (30-40 year olds), but I don't see why.  Google is right there, Bakery Square seems to be up and coming with youth, so why the "oldies"?  Was a penguins game night though. 5.  Good - outdoor seating.  Always a plus. 6.  Good and Bad - Beer.  The list is pretty long, but nothing too exciting.  Wish they had more local brews.  We did happen to go on a night where all cans were $2 or $3.  That's a great deal!  4 beers for $12.  That's the price of two drafts, depending on what kind of beer you drink, anywhere else.  Verdict - we'll stop again, but not on our list of tops.  Its a good place to go if you have some friends in from out of town, want a diverse and medium-priced menu, and don't mind the standard drink list.  Kids would also be fine there too.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

No7EfUm_rJubXwUmtpjpWw.text: Generally good for a quick bite if you're stranded at the hotel, however don't bother ordering out. Food is $$$ for the quality. You're better off with McDonalds.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

HdE8v_V78--TrUV_kTPKzQ.text: Great place to go if you have dogs! They have a separate dog menu :D. Food was decent but the service was not so great. We still had a great time because our dogs were included :)

h93E9ll6dawlpikNFNwkkQ.text: Really enjoyed my latest experience at social. I decided this time around that I would try sitting at the bar. I'm glad I did because the young bar tender was an absolute treat! He was friendly, up beat, and made a killer mojito.  I went with my mom who was in town visiting, and we decided to order appetizers since it was happy hour. We got the Buffalo chicken dip, which is my favorite app and we also ordered the Reuben balls (not sure if that's what they are called). We really enjoyed the chips, but they still don't give you enough chips for the dip!! We didn't ask for any additional because I know they cost extra. The Reuben balls were ok. I've had them before and they were much better the first time around. As for dinner, we ordered my favorite a pepperoni and red onion pizza. It was delicious per usual. I actually love the pizza here. It's better than the local pizza shops by far and I don't mind spending a little extra on good pizza. They use a thick cheese and real pepperoni. The pepperoni is thick and tender. The onion gives the pizza a little zing and balances out the meat and cheese. And if you were wondering the small feeds two people!

PzIYvRt05bhTxvIbz3MUZA.text: The happy hour at Social can't be beat.  It runs 5-7 and the craft cans are $2 or $3.  We went a little light and had the hot chicken dip and the Tuna lettuce wraps.  The dip came with your choice of pita and chips (Advice:  Do both, that is the way to go)  and as for the tuna wrap, i was thoroughly impressed with the tuna.  Super fresh and really tasty.    The bar was busy at 5 when i got there.  Some kind of party, but the bartenders were attentive, not overly chatty (although I was by myself for some time), which is what a bartender should be.   I have never had a bad experience there.  Don;t forget about Social brunch.  Limited menu but satisfying.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. America.

e_Ch2DdIiRDYMKteOk0VFA.text: Delicious cocktails. They have great Sangria and an excellent whiskey drink called Brooklyn Bridge.   We had a large group party there and overall service was excellent but they turn up the music super loud later in the evening. So loud that I couldn't even talk to my guests without shouting. I lost my voice for 6 days after that, so I would never have a party there again. We even asked them multiple times to turn it down and they turned it up instead. Not very speedy with service.   I love the Asian salad. And their pizza is pretty good, too. Overall I would come here for good drinks. They have great craft beers for all you beer enthusiasts out there, and delicious high-end cocktails. And the location in Bakery Square is perfect since there is 3hr free 3 parking in the garage.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Meatball Sandwich
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu

PEaAFvN0vF3-qj_JIajv9g.text: Loved this place! $2 and $3 beers and ciders on Wednesday! Our waitress was amazing and bought us a drink when we couldn't decide between two of them. Half off appetizers 5-7pm! Got the c and c nachos which was HUGE and delicious. 10/10 would come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. C and c nachos!

BjzU3oEwAOrb2wHapt0kXg.text: wow.   I'm not normally one to complain but this was awful.   service was kind of slow which was tolerable.   then my quesadilla came out,  or rather the charred remains of it.   burned.   as in the tortilla was black.    i didn't bother mentioning it to staff,  it didn't seem like anyone would care.  i just paid and left.

O_2wqE57ZRuRb_e2BwcVtg.text: I have been to Social about 4 times and I am starting to become a fan. I had their brunch twice and I haven't yet been disappointed.   One of the main reasons why I go to social is because of their happy hour. I think they have one of the best happy hours on this side of Pittsburgh. It is cheap, great drinks and food, what more can you ask for?   The staff that took care of our table were always attentive and knowledgeable of what they had on their menu and gave wonderful suggestions.

E3zDrfWY87KCX3X0gwEPXA.text: Went here for dinner on a Saturday night. Great daily drink specials/happy hour and even more specials during games. With a decent size menu and huge portions, we ended up with wayyyy too much food but everything was great. I'd say the pizzas were most memorable. Our waitress could've been a little more friendly but Social had a good hang out bar atmosphere.

CQT0s0MizgMyvnbqFU5tAw.text: Griff was our server last night and he was fantastic. We weren't sure how many people were joining us, so they set up a long table for us outside. We ended up having a group of about 20 that all pulled up chairs at different times. Normally servers might be annoyed by this, but Griff did not seem to have a problem with it. Even though we just had happy hour drinks and apps, he remembered everyones order without even writing it down. He was very attentive to us and kept making a point to refill our waters. At the time that we were done, he gave us all separate checks without even having to ask! He remembered who had what, and even split shared items on checks. Normally servers have a problem with splitting checks, especially for how many people we had, but Griff did not. Overall he was a fantastic server and I look forward to seeing him the next time I come in!

JohBOCD3xsrbbW5HvBhcpQ.text: Went for a burger and beer to celebrate a personal accomplishment. The beer selection is top notch. The burger was cooked and garnished perfectly.  Plenty of screens to watch the game. Outdoor seating, with game tables is a bonus. Pet friendly too.   Only complaint is that they seem to be google priced. Beer is way cheaper at WM Penn Tavern nearby, but that doesn't take any points off.

o2NLWQCyeZcKYuUb3D7iyQ.text: It was alright waiter wasn't the most pleasant we had a person with us that really is gluten intolerant and he was rather rude with his comments towards the end of Happy Hour! Food was good but not great! Being my first time here I wasn't too impressed but might try it out again in the future. We were there Friday March 16th!

-eWFjjdgCWY0oIveZ0r_kg.text: I've had hit or miss experiences with the food here.  The menu is large so at least there are lots of options.  I also love that they allow dogs on the patio.  This is why I continue to go there despite the slow service this place is notorious for.  However, after the experience I had today, I will not be back.  I showed up here with my dog and two friends right before a Steelers game. The patio was understandably packed, and after standing around for a few minutes without seeing a single staff member, we decided to seat ourselves. (I've been to social 5+ other times, and have never once been seated by a host)   All we could scrounge up were two 2-seat tables.  My bf began to move the two tables together since they were literally our only option.  An extremely angry employee charged very aggressively at my boyfriend and said "DID YOU GO TO THE HOST STAND? NO! YOU DIDN'T! YOU'RE OUT HERE MESSING UP EVERYONE'S SECTIONS!"    At that point, we just turned and left.  I will not ever be returning.  I can understand being annoyed that people are coming in and moving tables, but maybe there should be clear signage so people know that a host will eventually help them.  Beyond that, there is simply no excuse for a staff member to ball up his fists and posture like he's about to enter a fistfight with a customer.  My mind is absolutely blown.

6PtfEO2_90uP8POuHL3CPA.text: The food was nothing to be impressed about. I went there for brunch this weekend. The menu itself consisted of unnecessary complicated twists on traditional brunch items, I'm assuming to appeal to more hipster crowds (i.e. see hipster Benedict on the menu). The menu just makes you ask yourself instead, "which food will I probably hate the least".    I got the French toast medallions and a couple of them weren't even cooked the whole way through. It was just mush on the inside, very gross and unsafe since it was essentially uncooked egg. Took a couple bites of my friends food as well (he got the breakfast burrito) and again- nothing to be impressed with. With how many breakfast places there are in Pittsburgh I can confidently say that I will not be going there again.

NV61YU3YCCyZg7OfVsnP0w.text: Had brunch at social for the first time today with a large group. I thought my food was pretty good, but the service was somewhat lacking.  When I arrived and asked if anyone from my group had shown up yet, the first waiter who spoke to me was super rude, and made fun of me, as if saying "I'm looking for a large group, name ---" is a bizarro thing to say when you come in! Then he went to "double check" and never came back. Luckily, a nicer waiter came while I was waiting and took me to my table with neither hesitation nor snark.  The restaurant was basically empty except for our table, but everything took forever to come out. Six of us ordered bloody marys (maries?) and it must have been 25 minutes before they came back. During that time, nobody checked with us about anything.  The bloody mary was enjoyable - it was very spicy, which I liked, but not very strong, which I didn't like so much. I ordered the breakfast pizza without the bacon, (tater tots on pizza just sounds delightful). It was ok, but the eggs were scrambled and pretty set, and there was no sauce. This made for a very dry pizza. I think it could have been much improved by a generous drizzling of some kind of sauce (a sriracha mayo maybe?)  The rest of their menu intrigued me enough that I will likely return for dinner. I hope I don't run into that waiter again, though.

JfzLMx4Wn14JKw1UNiZwJg.text: Food is decent, not great but not bad. Service is ALL OVER THE PLACE. They seem overwhelmed by the usual crowds of young folks who like to hang out there after work and drink. Brought my family there last weekend and ordered a bunch of appetizers and each ordered an entree. They brought nothing for a long time, forgot to bring one of our drinks, and never asked about refilling our drinks... Finally they brought the entrees, closely followed by the appetizers. I spoke to the manager about that one. Honestly, you'd think this was run by high school students.  The wait staff all seemed to be about 16 years old, perhaps 20 at most, and they seemed... confused....    OK, as for the food: we ordered wings, which were dry (not coated with a sauce like every other wing place I have been to).  Their pizzas are decent and served on little platforms that take up so much room that we ran out of room at the table. I ordered tacos, which were really unimpressive and kind of dry.  Overall not a good experience. Probably a good place to go after work and have a beer if you work at Google.  Not a place to bring a family. Too noisy and badly run.

VZzHzKTo1ppTnE4Eo7-m2g.text: Pros: Delicious pizza and Bloody Marys. Cons: Noise level and slow-ish service  We rode our bikes to Social (Yay!) and were able to sit outside on a beautiful day. Parking can be rough in this area, so it was pleasant to deal with bike parking instead of car.   I started off with, what I would call, a "rustic" Bloody Mary that was awesome. Ordered fries for appetizer but they couldn't be awesome with awesome sauce because that is not vegetarian (Boo!). Fries alone were only ok, but then again, I don't share the same fry taste buds as most Burgher's because I don't like Kennywood fries!  The 2 small pizzas came and they were so filling that we were eating the leftovers for several days. The mushroom Bianca and the Roasted Cauliflower were so tasty!  All of the service was friendly but a bit slow. We've visited another time and it was the same. The acoustics were not the best. What I found odd was that the outside enclosure was pretty loud as well.  But this doesn't out-weigh the positives so we will go back.

E8It-HMwmgh5G66NNfIKRg.text: I always have great experiences here. The patio us fantastic, even in cold days they have it heated!  The soups and salads her are creative and delish!

Xg6OwY0HtjB6jB_tMQk2hQ.text: Came here with friends. The inside was loud, which makes conversation difficult we ate outside on a beautiful afternoon instead. I had the social burger and it was well cooked. They talk about their social sauce, but it really didn't add anything to the burger. You could barely taste the sauce. A friend of mine had a Philly cheese steak type sandwich, and it was overcooked and greasy. The fries were yummy. The beers were interesting. I would eat here again. But it's not one that I would make a special trip to search out. The staff t shirts are fun and we had great service. I do think they need one that says social butterfly.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sad that we need to teach adults how to be social.
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Local beer

AxZLXgzEls_epS17B8wp5w.text: Full disclosure: I am very critical of restaurant staff because I am a fifteen year industry veteran and have zero tolerance for phonies. This place is filled with them.   We had a large party and a child. We ordered uncomplicated items and tried to make it as easy on the staff as possible.   Our server, Christian, did a great job and was the ONLY one hustling during a fairly brisk pace of business. She deserves a pat on the back and recognition for basically carrying her team the entire time we were there. I watched her running around the entire restaurant as the rest of the staff slowly meandered around shooting the shit and basically doing nothing.   I watched three times as our drinks sat at the service bar maybe 15 feet away from us while multiple staffers walked by, made conversation with the bartenders or by the computer station. I almost got up and told them to get our drinks multiple times but my girlfriend wouldn't let me as we were with her family. It was so annoying to see one person working so hard while everyone else had social hour... Maybe that's where they got their name, who knows.   Two of our food items were wrong but we only mentioned one issue which took far too long to resolve. We asked for more cheese on our pizza and it took LITERALLY 12 minutes to get our pie back. The 'manager' brought it back to us and apologized but after watching her underperform for the entirety of our visit I was less than willing to accept her apathy as authentic.   All in all it may be a good place to drink as their happy hour includes half off pitchers of shitty beer (they have good beer but its not included in happy hour, wtf) so there's that. The food wasn't bad but it wasn't good either, could be best described as concept-centric completely lacking in creativity.    Christian was the only saving grace. She was really trying and is the only reason we stayed. She should look for work at a better restaurant where her abilities won't be squandered.   We were given a gift card to return as a gesture from the same 'manager' but we passed it off to a neighbor who likes shitty beer as we will not be going back.   Get your act together or get out and make room for something worthwhile.

bUCao11Bn8X9w2SyBI710w.text: Sangria is awesome- please try it! Outside seating is also a nice touch. Recently I came in for lunch. They have GF pizzas, so I wanted to see what other GF items they had on the menu. Unfortunately, it's just the pizzas, salads, and some soups and apps. They don't have GF bread or buns for the sandwiches and burgers, which was disappointing. I started with the tomato soup, which was good but a little tart. The soup was slopped into the bowl and there was dried soup all over the sides, and it was served with crackers in plastic wrap (tacky). The margherita GF pizza was lackluster. They used sliced heirloom tomatoes and fresh basil, I just wished for more toppings and I wished the toppings went all the way to the crust. It's in a great location. I went one night for drinks and it was filled with 30 and 40 somethings and very bright. It is just ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Stuffed pepper sandwich - made with spicy banana peppers
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beer &amp; sandwich

O-ApoH58GV6HjLEL55rJtA.text: They have the best beer special in town! Wednesday night is Shit Can Wednesday with select cans for only $2. They have a good selection of microbrews in cans. You can't beat it! The kitchen is only open until 11 though. Most of the food is pretty good. I haven't had a bad pizza yet and the mahi sandwich is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Even your beer knows where you should drink!
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pickle backs! Whiskey and pickle juice. Who knew?

Xop4uRlaAp7G43hAfrqcQA.text: This restaurant was just okay. We went during the playoff season and it was awesome with the many tv's set up all around the bar and patio. The setting was loud and crowded, which was expected on an NHL playoff night. That didn't bother us so much. Our biggest issue was the quality of food. We ordered a large buffalo chicken pizza and we were not fans of it. If I could describe it, I'd say it was toasted bread soaked in buffalo sauce, with some blue cheese chunks and chicken scattered on the pizza. The pizza was dripping with buffalo sauce. That's what threw us off. The pizza crust was also too thin for us. The service was fine, and the setting was awesome. They had many other items on the menu, they might be great! We also did not order any drinks that night. This pizza was just not our favorite, and I would not go back for the pizza. I would like to go back and try some of their other choices!

gAzi7aV1u69Vsf8HHIEoMw.text: Food is not good. Drinks and drink specials are worth going for.   $2 can beer Wednesdays!

raPlfiD-jFy-qZ2uw0BrtQ.text: I'm glad I came back to Social because they really impressed me this time. A large group of singers from Renaissance City Choir (check us out!) went to Social after a recent performance to celebrate. Our server didn't bat an eye at our group of 15 or so, kept our drinks coming, food came out in a timely fashion, checks were split with no hesitation, all with a smile and a friendly demeanor. Wow! Color me impressed.  On top of that, the food was great. I had Thai shrimp tacos which were so good, and a slice of a friend's buffalo chicken pizza, which had such good crust and nicely charred chicken on top. My husband was raving about his pierogi pizza too.

FHvtjzlCf3tEP_sK2kaQ6A.text: 3 stars is a gift on this one. We went for brunch, but I ordered  from the regular menu. The service was slow, I think once the waitress realized we weren't drinking she decided the tip wasn't worth the effort. I had to flag her down to get more coffee. The food was lackluster at best. We got the cauliflower patties that everyone raves about, they were greasy and salty. My grilled cheese & soup was alright, but pretty boring, the breakfast pizza my boyfriend had sounded great but was a disappointment. Nothing tastes horrible just the kind of food you would expect to get at a chain pub. Oily & salty. Definitely not worth the trip. If I lived in bakery square I might stop by to drink as the atmosphere is nice, but the food isn't worth the $$$!

L26Xr9LLpAkhNnM7--GchA.text: I cannot explain the disappointment with this location. I came here one and a half years ago however yesterday was a different experience. We have absolutely no concerns with our server however the food we were served is a disgrace. Cauliflower patties were reheated and not hot at at. They appeared to be old. Later we were served fries (which we sent back and were served the same thing again) which looked like they were old and re fried (picture attached please judge for yourself management). The only thing that tasted okay was the pita bread which is obviously not made at the location. Our falafel were not even cooked on the inside and we had to leave our meal on the table. They should not be allowed to sell old food to people who are expecting a good lunch. Maybe okay if all you expect is beers which again are not made by them either.

riNZlPQOV6JrxgVh9mgUXg.text: Dogs are permitted on the patio and they even get their own water bowl.   Enough said.

NazqpzQkLKQ22Z_6WWPJfA.text: I come to social often because it's a short walk from home. I mainly come for apps and drinks which have been good. On two occasions I've had issues with my meal. My philosophy is that we will all make mistakes or we all have bad days, but what's important is how those mistakes are dealt with. On those two occasions, the staff was apologetic and went above and beyond to make the situation right. I've appreciated this about Social and it's why I return.

n924non5gay2LlD6j8eqOQ.text: I went in there with plans for a salad.  While the salads are awesome - they give you a paper menu and you pick out what you want thrown in, I didn't want to end up with a $40 salad.  And trust me, with toppings like grilled shrimp, steak cooked to order, artichokes, asparagus, cheeses galore - it would have definitely been 40 bucks.   So the hubby and I started with the ahi nachos.  I think it's a bit of a misnomer to call them nachoes since it was just single chips with tuna and guac on them, they were awesome no matter what they were called.  The tuna was very fresh and had a nice sauce on it.  The guac was the perfect amount.  The chip was super crispy and nicely seasoned.   We then decided to split the pierogie pizza and damn, are we glad we did.  It was gigantic, seriously huge.  The crust was cooked to a buttery golden brown and very crispy.  Very unique type crust.  It was covered with carmelized onions, bacon, sliced fingerlings and a garlic aoili.  Absolutely fantastic!  We will be back, oh yes, we will be back.

nlYfqZfJ3LcfWLcvySCBYw.text: This was our first visit. We liked the atmosphere and rustic accents. The service wasn't great (especially for a place named social) but not a total deal breaker. Nacho app had great flavor but a little soggier than preferred. Loved the 'build your own salad' concept, but I wasn't impressed with the mahi. I'd try it again with chicken though. My husband's meatloaf sandwich with smashed egg was by far the best thing ordered at our table. We'd try this place again; the pizza at a neighboring table looked goooood.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nacho app.

M2PoV6GHJqa9uoWgcuiwwQ.text: The food, drinks, atmosphere, and service are all sub-par. It's only saved by the fact that it is the only bar in Bakery Square. If it had any competition at all, I wouldn't go back. I usually end up going out of my way to avoid it anyhow already.

o3lxBddxA9F_OLZMeYiR4Q.text: During happy hours, great deals on good beer.  I had the Thai Steak Salad and was very pleased.  This was a dinner sized salad with lovely bits of edamame, carrot, and crunchy wonton strips. The steak was perfectly cooked and paired nicely with a spicy peanut dressing.    The service was a little rushed and scattered, but all in all, good.  At the end of our meal we were encouraged to stick around and drink more at the table, which I love (although I understand kicking people out to sit at the bar, I still hate it!).     Get your drinks while you can during happy hour, though, because the prices sure do get high afterwards!  I'd definitely be back and I'd be excited to take people here in the future.

H5oiDcwkBIb57siiilZ8ug.text: Had lunch with my sister in law here, she had been there before; looked up Yelp reviews and was unsure. We where seated outside on a beautiful day, service was friendly and fast, I ordered the Ruben, my SIL the Cuban, both sandwiches where huge and very tasty! I highly recommend this place!

pgLi4J-KIh6VKUzZ4UX6fA.text: Great happy hour stand-by. There is lots of free parking either in the surface lot at Bakery Square, or the parking garage, so that's a bonus. The place has a fun atmosphere in the evenings with sports on all the flat screens, darts, etc. The food is tasty, and the menu shifts often enough to be interesting. I would skip the brunch, which I have found to have no stand-outs (especially in light of the several other amazing brunch offerings in PGH), and instead head in for happy hour, which I think goes to 7 or 7:30 on weeknights. Great app and drinks specials. The hubs and I usually split 2 or 3 half price apps as dinner, and grab a couple of beers. The flatbread is great--as anything with bacon jam and a fried egg will be. The Rueben balls are great, and I don't even like ruebens. On the regular menu--the turkey burger is delicious, actually my favorite turkey burger anywhere. Skip the pizza, and resist the urge to get the chicken/waffle sandwich-- it's greasier than sin, and not as satisfying as you want it to be. Grilled cheeses are great. All in all--this will not be a healthy meal, but will hit the spot, and if you go during happy hour, can be pretty cheap.

x5aANEUQtUqPD7IUbfp8hQ.text: LOVE this place. Food is always fresh, tasty, delicious. Staff is super friendly. Was only in town for a few days and ate here for dinner every night! Love the menu as well.

7ZzlsB_YQu1caaqZ-8ueZw.text: A couple of us grabbed drinks out on the patio for an early happy hour on Friday. It wasn't that busy yet our service was pretty slow.  Our waiter was also unknowledgeable about the beers on draft.  I liked the covered outdoor seating though.

UEUyswOj7Uzv-HhbyxdOjg.text: We went to Social for Brunch this past Sunday around 1pm.  We had a great time.  We parked at the garage in Bakery Square and it's free for your first 3 hours.  That's all we needed!  It was pouring rain outside too so that really helped.       First of all the place looks great inside.  Anywhere that you sit you can see the television if you were watching a sporting event.  I always look for that when I review a place.  We sat in a booth but the bar looked great.  It's nice and open and I will sit there then next time that we visit.       I was really hungry so I ordered the French Toast Medallions.  My brother in law and his girlfriend ordered the Breakfast Burrito (without the chorizo) and wifey got the Hipster benedict.  They had no complaints about their food.  It looked good and they were stuffed after they ate.  My medallions looked great.  I couldn't wait to eat them.  They were really good I just wish I had more.  I was so hungry that I should have ordered a side of eggs to fill me up all of the way.  The French toast did come with 2 pieces of bacon that were very good but it still wasn't enough for me.  I think if I would have ordered the burrito or the hipster benedict I would have been more full.  Anyways that was my fault I should have known to order more.       Regardless it was a really good brunch.  My brother in law introduced us to a beermosa.  It was just a half of glass of orange juice with a half a glass of a lite beer.  It was really good.  I'm going to have that more often and it's cheap!         The only  negative was their service towards the end of our brunch.  I thought our waitress was really good at first.  Just after they served us our food she checked back once but she never came back after.  I wanted another drink and we would have ordered a few more if she ever came back.  We had to go out of our way to flag her down just to get our check.  That was really weird because she was great at first.  Oh well we will still comeback and probably just sit at the bar next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carrie enjoying her beermossa!
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French toast medallions

HHyDRESnSp-W7JP-WQ-NbA.text: Drink specials are fine, pizza is fair, but the food overall leaves something to be desired.  Came in for dinner here, it seems more of a drinking place than eating, which is a shame since they're clearly trying to be a restaurant and attract customers who may be staying at the hotel across the parking lot (I was, BTW).  It was a Thursday evening, I ordered a beer that caught my attention on the menu. It's $6 per 12oz can here just to warn you. However, since this was Thursday, 12oz cans from a certain brewery were half price. But I was not told of this by the waiter, and didn't find out until it was too late, so I ended up paying $6/12oz. Thankfully I only had a couple beers, but really they should inform customers if a special is on for certain drinks on certain days, because i would've gotten the beer on special for $3/12oz if I'd known.  I ordered the appetizer "Reuben Fritters". Description is: Corned beef, Swiss, rye, and sauerkraut, fried to perfection with Social's house sauce. This was not good, plain and simple. It was just deep-fried balls of batter, with some meat and other stuff mixed into it, that had no taste. This dish has corned beef in it, which is famous for strong flavor. This dish has sauerkraut in it, which is famous for strong flavor. This dish has rye in it, which, likewise, is famous for strong flavor. Well, I couldn't taste any of these flavors in the fritters. All I could taste was the fried batter. The dish was just so BLAND, even the "social sauce" they put on it couldn't save it. Severely disappointing, which is too bad because a dish like this has so much flavor potential given its ingredients, but either it's not being cooked in the right way, or the chef simply cannot cook it.  For my main, I ordered the Social Distortion pizza: Consists of: marinara, mozzarella, banana peppers, salumi, roasted mushrooms and oregano. It was fairly decent. The pizza in general is cooked pretty well at Social; crust is crispy and it's easy to break off triangles and eat by hand. You'd be surprised how many pizza restaurants can't even get this right. The toppings on this are supposed to be unique to the restaurant I guess, but I didn't really find them special or all that different to what I might get somewhere else. Seasoning was nothing special either, so it was a decent pizza, nothing more nothing less.  2 stars means you were disappointing, Social, but you were not horrible. But in this case it also means that I KNOW you can do better. Especially with those Reuben Fritters. What are you thinking taking ingredients that are known to be so flavorful, and deep-frying them to hell so that they have no flavor left? Maybe it's because there's more drinking than eating going on in your restaurant, that customers don't notice this? Well, I did. You need to step up your game, and I definitely think you could. The pizza at least has a solid foundation but I think this place could improve on that too, with seasonings and fresher ingredients and the like

iplTSkzwbxqO-h_fS9ruaw.text: Social REALLY impressed me! I stopped in for dinner with a friend conveniently during their happy hour (half off apps & beer/wine specials!!). In True cheapskate form, we made a meal out of just appetizers. Penny pinchers unite! Don't let the appetizer title fool you, these portions were pretty hefty! My friend ordered a plate of tots and ended up with enough to feed a tiny army. She also got an order of the jerk wings which she thought was delicious. For myself, I ordered the black bean quesadilla. SO GOOD! The black bean filling was great and avocado crema was a nice complement. Last but certainly not least, I had the roasted red pepper hummus which came with pita and tortilla chips - also fantastic! We each got 2-3 meals out of it and paid less than $10 each. Success!  The ONLY thing keeping me from giving Social a 5 star rating is the horrendous customer service. My friend arrived first and was not acknowledged by our waiter until 20 minutes after being seated. Once we were finished with our meal, we wasted half an hour trying to find him to get our checks. I was 5 seconds away from calling up a search party. The dude was seriously M.I.A.! We ended up asking another waitress to fetch us our check because it was getting ridiculous. Even though it was a rocky experience with our waiter, I would absolutely come back because the food is great and the happy hour deals are just too good to pass up!

Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Black Bean Quesadilla

XZizup338mVlpK5rqHdkNQ.text: Had the shrimp salad (tasty) and a martini (generous pour). No complaints.  Then I had the peanut butter cup cookie -- that's a really great cookie!

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

gq5_sK1gMN2GAsTYltFKqw.text: Mediocre food. Came here for brunch and got the hipster Benedict. My food came out cold with two sloppy eggs on top. The food tasted bland. Usually the eggs in an eggs Benedict is poached. Mine was sunny side up, cold with no signature hollandaise sauce! Furthermore, the food is kind of over priced considering the quality. I will not be returning here.

xwOfQ7zwXOGius_GDGvvbA.text: I've eaten here a few times. All in all the food is basic and ok. But, but, but...there's something about the custom made salads. I like filling out the checklist with all of the veggies, cheeses, etc available and then having that glorious salad placed in front of me. Talk about a big salad; Elaine's big salad on Seinfeld has got nothing on these salads.   Pizza is ok too.  I've never actually had alcoholic beverages here but I know they have specials.

cmSwMbS6QINUTN2XrR29FA.text: I absolutely love this place. They have fresh food & lots of vegetarian options.  The cauliflower patties are out of this world! Crispy on the outside & creamy on the inside with a lemon aioli. This time I got the Mushroom Panini & it was delicious. Vegetables were well seasoned which is uncommon with a lot of vegetarian dishes at other restaurants. I recommend this place to everyone that i know.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mushroom Panini with Tots
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cauliflower Patties with Lemon Aioli

qIMvsTn40dTMOoQ0TrMF_g.text: Definitely a hidden gem. I just discovered this place today and will probably be back sometime later this week. Perfect for a few beers or some good food with friends. There is an outdoor patio which is spacious and the inside is well decorated with outstanding service. prices are good for portion size!   We got the mac and cheese (10/10), tomato and cheese soup, the kale caesar, shrimp salad, and the chicken salad wrap. The mac and cheese is oven baked in a skillet with the perfect hint of spice. Not overpowering but gives the dish something a little extra that you wouldn't normally taste in mac and cheese. The kale caesar has these homemade croutons that I honestly would buy an extra side of. The chicken salad is unique as well. it had peas in it which I never had in a chicken salad before but it was amazing!   Really good restaurant! I would consider it a cafe because of the soup and salad options, but I also heard the pizza is great. Will have to test that out next time!
