piICS3MIMAdrVLCPGXBbAQ.text: This place surprised the heck out of me. Excellent bar food. Two thumbs up. Bartenders were very friendly and welcoming. Great experience. I highly recommend.

kn6bwFN6LHN3O4lm3WcP_g.text: At 11 am today I tried to make a company reservation for 12 noon  at Social at Bakery Square for 8 people, and the manager told me he needed a credit card to hold the spot. If we don't show, MY credit card will be charged $50.   Our company is literally located two doors down from the restaurant, and we have had several lunches here in the past.. We never broke a reservation! Plus, It's the coldest day of the year, I doubt we would HAVE BEEN A no show in one hour. Bad customer service. Also, people coming from work have a limited amount of time and reservations would help us make the most of our time. The workers are kind of rude too! They even took one of our chairs and put it at another table...before we could get an answer out...they just took it. Tip: buy more chairs.  I have never experienced this at a restaurant before. I've been to high class restaurants and middle of the road restaurants but none ever treated us so bad. I will never eat there again. You may want to because the food is pretty good...just don't expect to be accommodated. SMH

v8cx0GvQq7BC_lV-XYydVQ.text: Food was good service was bad bartend seemed like she didn't want to be there. The atmosphere was great place was nice. It was dead and the bartender was very unatentive could of cared less for her guests needs. We would have stayed longer if she was a bit more friendly and attentive instead went elsewhere and tipped the next bartender very well being that I am a bartender myself. I can't wait for the next place that will be in this spot it is a great location. Being in the industry for awhile I can't see them lasting very long with such lousy service. I Never leave reviews but experience was that bad I felt I needed to leave one.

EErLtP_JYH8aXv9IF_VPcQ.text: I have such mixed feelings about this place that I wanted to approach this similar to Four Weddings on TLC:  Venue: 4/10 - I'm really confused by it? It's a nice spot but the decor confused me? Brick and bark and 4 styles of lights. What are trying to be? Staff: 5/10 - Our server was very nice and attentive enough to make it a pleasing experience. The hostess, however, seemed to really not care for her job. Not going to get into details but I just feel that if you're the *first face* the customer sees, you should at least attempt to be friendly.   Food/Drinks: 7/10 - Meh. Moscow Mule didn't come in a copper mug which would be fine if it were tasty. Nachos were subpar (and your girl LOVES nachos). I got the steak salad and it was very good. Nothing special.  Overall Experience: 6/10 - Social won't ever be my "first choice," but I'd go again if someone asked me to meet them there.

knvGSimJS3J5JLV7ITizSA.text: Service was great !!! Fun atmosphere. Did not care for the drinks-- at all. Bloody Mary's were on special and mediocre at best, I got a Moscow mule and it was extremely bland. The pierogi pizza was intriguing and pretty good. Portions are big!

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

WxQ4mK2kx8c8uTctzA9K3g.text: Food is great, good beer selection. Service is awful. Used to come here a lot, and the service was wonderful, lately bartenders and waiters/waitresses don't come around to check on you. Only come to serve food/checks and if you  flag them down. Hopefully quality of service picks up to match the quality of the food.

hdinCUg2PEPAgy-XResbAA.text: I want to like this place as it is SO conveniently located to where I live.  And I've let my other bad experiences go by the wayside.  Today, not so much.  Every time I go to Social something is seriously wrong with the service.  Today, I was told by the bartender (I had lunch at the bar) that wine was 50% off so it might more sense to buy the bottle (rather than order 1 glass) and take what is left over home with me.   So, I did just that.   When the bill came, my JW Morris Pinot Noir was billed at $18.00.  When I asked if a full bottle was really $36, the bartender said yes.  SAY WHAT?  I swore it was much less than that on the menu and it retails in a wine store for around $15.00.    There was not a drink menu to be found when I went looking for it and the bartender didn't offer to show it to me...I'm just sayin'!  Oh and the burger came out cold but the fries were nice and hot.

VibOCrviPpuM5VuxF5CPfg.text: I've been to Social a couple times.  I - as I have said in other reviews - almost always give places 2 chances.    My first experience was - eh.  My date and I sat at the bar and both ordered appetizers and drinks to share. First drink my date got - cracked glass.  They just poured that drink into another glass.  What if there was a sliver of glass that made it's way into the cup?  A new drink should have been made.  I know it seems wasteful, but it's better than injuring someone.  Then...it took significant effort to get the attention of anyone to get more drinks.  Thank goodness we didn't want more food.  The bartenders were too busy flirting with the ladies at the end of the bar.  Or maybe they were regulars.  Regardless - you never know who your next regular could be.  My second experience, again was - eh.  I probably won't go back.  My co-worker and I decided to go after completing a few weeks of what seemed like HELL at work.  We were both looking forward to a grilled cheese and tomato soup.  What a disappointment!  I would have rather gone to panera for their tomato soup.  Our waiter - again, took significant effort to get attention.    What got us is the picture I posted.  Before I posted it, I checked their menu and the other pictures on here.  Sometimes restaurants spell things different because "that's their thing".  Yeah, learn to spell special correctly.  These were cards on ALL the tables and the bar.    Just disappointed all around both times.  I drive past Social every day on my way home from work.  It'd be a great happy hour location, but after my 2 experiences, I'm doubtful there will be a third.    The only reason they got 3 stars is their Cauliflower patties are pretty awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. I looked at EVERYTHING (Menu, etc) to ensure that spelling &#34;Specails&#34; wrong wasn&#39;t &#34;their thing&#34;.  I couldn&#39;t find any evidence of such.

Dv14xVMYBEWR9q11pY4r1g.text: Went there on the spur of the moment. Sat outside in the shade. Ordered the falafel sandwich and tots. Can't wait to go back and get it again!!

cmaAIOLl3mFIH-kCKDWN9Q.text: Never go to this place. Service is slow and lazy. Food was undercooked. Manager was rude and unhelpful

SQM9Oe_ndcVHEL4ZCegNZw.text: I have been to social a couple of times.  All the times I get the same feeling.  This place has real potentials, especially due to its location and atmosphere, to become a popular joint with locals, but I think there are a few things that need to be improved here.  I understand that the place is fairly new (I think right now it is not even 2 months old) but the service stuff, even though polite and helpful seem to not be aware of the menu and some basic processes (e.g., remembering orders, splitting bills, leaving straws for drinks etc.).  Coming to the food part I have mixed feelings.  Whatever I have tried tasted ok, however many times most of the people in my company are not really satisfied with their plates.  All in all, I think I will give it a try again but maybe a couple of months later so as people to have some time to improve.

e5ZolFX628xo6L9A279Y8A.text: I'm usually a fan of social; however, tonight was the worst restaurant experience I've ever had. My girlfriend found what looked like a live caterpillar (possibly a maggot)  crawling through her salad. The service was slow the whole night and I had to basically chase down the waiter to inform him of the live creature in my girlfriends food while my girlfriend tried not to puke in the bathroom. I will never visit this restaurant again and hope that others will read this before accidentally being fed live maggots by this disgusting excuse for a restaurant.

Zkie_PO-WgJMYmfqTdY5ZA.text: I had the Jamaican Jerk wings and they were pretty good. The fries are delicious. Kind of pricey, but overall a good place to eat.

T2bWfKT5iVrFc7C2WGPWJw.text: Not too impressed with the food here. I had the peanut thai pizza, which was alright, a bit on the dry side. My boyfriend got the shrimp salad, which was a little better. I would probably give this place another try though since their menu seemed to have a lot of interesting options. Maybe they were just having an off night. The waitress was really nice and helpful.

SuC47hFLggt19XqTAD_MeA.text: This place is decent for a quick bite to eat and a drink. They have plenty of craft brews and cocktails to choose from. We ordered the cauliflower patties, southwest salad, and jerk wings. The wings were a little dry, but the taste made up for it. The mango jalapeno dipping sauce was pretty damn tasty. Everything on the salad was fresh and the cauliflower patties were nothing special, but they were good.

q-ttXUXtYN2IPgYq83_t1w.text: I'm going to give social a 3 and heres why. the food here was good, actually everything we ordered was good, so no issue there. However, the space itself is pretty jenky for being brand new, the entrance is in the way of the waiter traffic, the layout make you feel like you may never see your server again, and to top it all off they have exposed refrigerator, with a slight bit more care, or through hiring a decent design organization this place could be awesome, but much like the rest of bakery square this place seems not quite done

clHs37fo47viU9XGwgKOxA.text: Got seated in a nearly empty restaurant,  a few minutes later someone who was not our server brought us water and said someone else would be our server.  Waited 10-15 minutes without anyone coming to our table.  We walked out as that was ridiculous.

HRLP6ByIUM7_pN6MWalZjw.text: Went for dinner and drinks. Great patio, really good drinks,  and we all really enjoyed our meals. The crowd and vibe were fun. We will definitely be back. Check out the house made turkey burger and nightly drink specials.

LmsbGuvducL7v47HzV1uOQ.text: socials concept is nice. i like the well designed menus and at a glance, there were lots of things to choose from... however...  the lighting in there is very bright. awkwardly bright. and something about how its painted made me feel like i was in a cafeteria. i'm a young 20-something that eats at modern restaurants all the time but this place didn't execute to it right. it feels stark, like i'm sitting in a garage almost. tables were too close together (guy behind me and my head were basically touching), host and waitress were both passively nice in a weird way, and there was not a young crowd here. actually surprised because it was a lot of families and older folks - totally fine - just not what i expected at all.  food was not good. i had a salad that i almost sent back. too much dressing, butter lettuce on a caesar (so weird), and the dressing didn't taste "truffled" as the menu suggested, it actually tasted really generic and not very caesar at all. my friend got a sandwhich that did not have much meat. we were disappointed.  honestly, i think things could be improved here and i'd try it again. they have the typical daily specials like sister-restaurant shady grove, but at this point, i'll stick with the original.

BgBOdQ2WiLLebI6ft5lrmQ.text: I went with a group of friends- 6 of us total- for the first time last night. It was a pleasant experience and we are looking forward to visiting again soon. I felt compelled to write this review after noticing some lackluster reviews on yelp. The service was great. The hostess and wait staff are pleasant and upbeat and worked to accommodate seating for us, as our party grew from three people to six quickly. Our server, Dan, was very helpful throughout the evening, making suggestions on substituting different greens in the grilled shrimp salad, since some of us were not fans of kale. Social's willingness to do so, where many kitchens frown on substitutions, was noted and another reason to love this place!  The food was flavorful, fresh, and plentiful. Grilled shrimp salad and southwest salads were group favorites and they had fresh, delicious salad dressings (on the side). The salads were large, but amazingly they disappeared - many clean plates in this group! The turkey burger was declared flavorful.  Drinks were also good. We ordered the happy hour special- 2 for 1 social cocktails. The "social punch" was fruity, not heavy on alcohol, and at half price, a great deal. Served in mason jars. Nice. Didn't have wine, but it was just $5 per glass and many beers for $2.  The decor is urban, the outdoor patio is kept comfortable in cool weather with heaters, kind of a neighborhood bar/restaurant feel that we enjoyed. The only negative is the loud background noise I think dining area. The music could be lowered as the place fills up. We decided to sit outside, which was a bit quieter.   We'll be back soon.  (Also note- Garage with 3 hours free parking nearby. Can't beat that!)

6cqOUTSCB7WxQsESr-MWdQ.text: My family and I came here for dinner at the recommendation of our hotel front desk due to how it was a decent and popular general restaurant and night life location. He wasn't wrong the place was pretty good, nothing amazing, but good. Service itself was ok, a lot of times our waitress would simply walk past us when we all had empty glasses on our table but it was quite busy and the food came out quickly so it's a rough in between I guess. The food for the main course itself was pretty good, not terrible but nothing special either. I had the Reuben and my parents had salads (I forget which ones) and all of our meals were quite large. My Reuben tasted quite nice, albeit really greasy but good none the less. We also had their nachos for an appetizer and I have to say that those were probably the nastiest thing I've ever eaten in my life, it was like eating overpriced Taco Bell, so skip those. They do have a full bar though, so if you want to knock back a few drinks they had some nice specials going like $3 Leinenkugel drafts among others. All in all its a decent stop, not some place I'd recommend to go to regularly or actively seek out, but if you're in the area and it's a convenient stop for you, you should go.

rlCdVOx6Pxbjj-JzswFXeA.text: Stopped in Thurs on my way through town. Food and atmosphere great. Server sweet girl named Maggie couldn't have been more helpful. Will definitely stop back here when in the Burgh.

3PBUxdkArdKP5UfczZKjeQ.text: We tried this restaurant on a beautiful day, and the outside area was a wonderful place to enjoy a meal. Unfortunately, it was marred by some unpleasant guests around us- a very unruly table (which we certainly can't blame the restaurant for), and a table with a dog that was barking and intruding on the space of every table around. I think the restaurant could have done a better job of controlling these issues and creating a pleasant dining experience for everyone. We both ordered "build your own" salads, which is a bit copy-cat from Bites and Brews, but is a nice option for those of us with food intolerances. The salads were good, but nothing to write home about. If you're looking for a nice outdoor space to eat, this place is great, but I wouldn't make the trip for the food or drinks otherwise.

RUGazuo3SDy8qcNRrxVuew.text: I've gotta say i'm pretty surprised at the number of bad reviews. I went here for the first time today and had an awesome experience. We had our dogs with us and luckily they have a very spacious patio outside so this wasn't a problem. Our waiter was superb! Often times when you sit outside you can feel forgotten about, but he was great about checking on us..refilling drinks..etc. Plus he was super warm and friendly without being over the top. I was in the mood for something healthy so I was ECSTATIC when I saw the "build your own salad" paper! Such a neat idea! It was pricey, but then again I put everything but the kitchen sink in mine so that added to the cost. My only complaint would be that the portion was way too small for the price, but other than that it was yummy and fresh tasting. By far the best part of this dining experience was the drinks! OMG. On Tuesdays they have 2 for 1 mixers so I got the berry margarita and my friend got (wait for it...) PUMPKIN SANGRIA! Both were phenomenal! Just the right amount of sweetness to alcohol ration and the sangria was one of the best drinks i've ever tasted.   Overall a great lunch and i'm so excited to have a place this cool so close to my house.

MzeswU5u8rZusmiI9YtN_g.text: This place is suffering from an identity crisis, but aren't we all these days? Natural wood and terrarium accents clash with bright lights and colors which compete with the multitude of TVs which interrupt the idea that this is a place where you would come to have conversations which questions the whole pro-new-media-we-are-located-in-the-same-building-as-google vibe. But I can kind-of get it; it is Pittsburgh's updated version of socializing (watching and talking about sports in a bright and airy post-industrial space while posting on Facebook and Instagram, or whatever, via smartphone). However, I don't think the atmosphere appeals to anybody in particular, certainly not to me, even though I love terrariums; and I've heard sports fans complain that they keep the volume off (or maybe it was too low) on the TVs (that's just what I heard, could be a rumor! But that's a natural consequence of Social contexts).  I half expected Social to have more techy stuff, like iPads at the table with apps that allow for communication with other tables to play games of sorts or select the music, or something, I wouldn't know. So, I've tried the veggie burger and it was just OK, and I had some pizza at an event once which was also alright. Then, there's a couple of REALLY well crafted things about Social: The Brooklyn Bridge and The Bourbon Blast.

mZxHMlz_u_Axxfzlzi-MKA.text: Very fresh salad, great coffee, but NOT good gluten-free pizza crust.  Unchewable, kinda like industrial cardboard.

Vz3dkSDFvju2FOxTmzAYyA.text: The food is good, definitely a decent menu. Standard American bar food, but a notch higher. The salads can be rather disappointing FYI, so bet on the phenomenal pizzas. My biggest complaint is the poor service. We came in on a Monday for dinner, which apparently is their trivia night. The music and announcer's microphone were so ungodly loud, we could barely place our orders with the waitress, let alone have dinner conversation. We asked if they could lower the volume, and were told that the trivia emcee doesn't like to go lower. Seriously? So, your emcee trumps your paying customers? If I were going to a rowdy bar, I might understand, but not at a casual restaurant. They did offer to reseat us at a farther away table but the speakers were still so loud it made no difference. Sure, the food is decent and it's nearby, but the insolent customer service is enough of a turnoff to make this a "if it's the apocalypse and this is the only place to eat" kind of restaurant.

HtGE4xiOrrLXNe4zfE8nxQ.text: I really enjoyed their Reuben Sandwich and Fries. The dressing on it was fresh with a bit of a kick to balance some of that sweetness you normally get. The kraut has a great texture and flavor. It's grilled without being "smashed" like some places are known to do. I give the sandwich a FIVE but I'm rating the overall experience a four because it is a tad loud if you're seated next to the bar and the wait staff were assigned too many tables to really be attentive. They tried, though.

Rzdp5Hl8qoMIPSSO0v1afw.text: We came here on a Friday night at 7 with a group of 25 or more.   We had 3 picnic tables waiting for us and a really nice waitress, Rachel.  It was 1/2 price bottles of wine night too!   We had a limited menu choice and that was fine.   Burgers were small but good served on a pretzel roll, good fries.   The pizza was tasty but soggy- it needs some work.    All in all a great place with great service good food and fun!   Check it out!

LmpBasDmkpCorl1mgxi9kQ.text: Poor service, sub-par food for the price, and some legitimately rude staff... I can accommodate a little of one of these things if the sacrifice is in favor of improving another, but honestly it just feels like this place feels entitled to people's business based on their location and they're not really doing anything of quality. I don't plan to return.

sH4NKICvva0WEO95j-wF4A.text: My hands down favorite place to drink/ eat in PGH! Friendly staff, food is amazing, good bar/ restaurant atmosphere. Love the all day drink specials and the turkey burger.

XGn-DYkcC0TqeEiLeNM7Hg.text: Social has become my new go-to bar.  Why? 1. Really good drink specials, both happy hour (5-7 boasts a HUGE selection of $2 beers) and daily.  Their drinks are on the pricy side when not on special, but unless there's only one thing you drink, you can find something very affordable. 2. FREE PARKING!  It's super close to where I live, but I can convince friends to join me over in 'Sliberty because of the ample ample free parking--both surface and garage. 3. Tasty tasty pizza.  The green eggs and ham...oh man. Rarely do I order the same thing twice, but I've had that delicious pizza on several occasions.  The pizzas look pricy from the outset, but once you see their size, it makes some sense--2 can easily split a large with a couple of slices to take home. 4. Friendly service! I've sat at the bar most of the time, and have gotten great recommendations from them.  They're generous with the pours (my companion had ordered a beer that came off the tap with a thick head of foam, and without any prompting from him, the bartender pulled him a fresh pour), and well-informed about the menu (allergies, etc).  But for Pete's sake, DO SOMETHING ABOUT THE FLOOR. I realize they're going for something a little "industrial-chic" but the floor is a huge eyesore, especially in the bathrooms.

APJ6sI3cj3ixiJgMBvTUmg.text: Stopped by Social while visiting Pittsburgh for the weekend. While I was not as impressed by the Reuben Fritters as some folks seem to be (very salty and almost burned), I did enjoy the Jacked Arnold Palmer which had a decent amount of alcohol and the two mimosas I had. The pizza would have been better if the crust hadn't been so crispy to the point of being burnt but the toppings were very tasty and I can imagine that if properly prepared it would have been awesome. Friendly service and atmosphere, I will visit again the next time I am in town.

Xvo4rNs-KkPmwReotjKTlw.text: Food was ok. Service was really terrible. While waiters and waitress were polite. People seated near us waited a long time for food only to find out for the waitress she never put their order in. Empty tables sat with dirty plates for 20 minutes. Bathroom was a mess. They seemed overall poorly staffed. Will not return.

CbsSkUjwSLEPnUj0-2-cSA.text: Menu is basic bar and grill cross section.  We had something from almost every section amongst our group, and it was all satisfactory.  Nothing awesome, but nothing disappointing.  The prices averaged maybe $1 per item higher than the many comparable places in Shadyside.  Which begs the question, why come to a less pleasant neighborhood for the same menu we can find (slightly cheaper) nearby at Mario's, Harris', Shady Grove, Bites and Brew, Elbow Room, 1947, etc?  There was also a diner with a dog on the patio while we were there.  I personally find it slightly off-putting to see a dog licking off one of the dishes.  But, if you have a dog, it might be a pet-friendly place to go for a meal.  I noticed another there as I was passing by today.  I wouldn't mind going back if someone I was with wanted to, but I just can't see a compelling reason to chose this place over the similar options on Walnut or Ellsworth.

27J2WmFdoyCLD-9mdVp0Bg.text: I've been to Social more than 10 times, but have only eaten there about 3.  The prices are high for the food quality.  As a vegetarian,  my options were limited but recently ordered the veggie burger. Worst one of my life. I have no issue with one that falls apart but this one was wet. It had the consistency of chunky mashed potatoes. I sent it back and the second one came out only slightly better.  The manager was understanding,  and my waitress was really sweet. Overall, be prepared for slow service and tight table arrangements.  They do, however,  have phenomenal tater tots!

rK7iMWlQIWtbcaqFT9nxGw.text: Had the burger - honestly the worst I have ever eaten in Pittsburgh. The patty was too lean - it was practically tasteless plus the mustard and burger together were horrendously salty - I really couldn't taste anything else. I won't be eating here again.

SDFXZW-P4dIZwxvPqXlb6Q.text: I love Social so much!! It's a great addition to the Bakery Square area. I would eat here every day if I could. The spinach and artichoke dip is delicious, and the fried chicken and waffle sandwich is so awesome. The waiters and waitresses were super friendly. All in all, it's a great place to eat.

j3T0zuX1JcbsyeLQIuFCYQ.text: Came for the soft opening so all the food was free. Food in general was unimpressive, not really good enough for me to pay money for...but then again that was only the soft opening so there's potential. Apparently drinks are pretty good here so I would see myself coming back for happy hour or something.

SJnHUKbyS433nVFsFidtBA.text: Social is a strange place.  The decor leaves a lot to be desired with electronic dart boards and a backlit cooler visible from any seat in the house.  Not a great place for socializing.  There are better places in the same price range nearby.  Turkey burger and their pizzas are good, but they seemed to have run out of fries when we went (or had the fryer off).  Rather than telling us, they ran to the nearby McDonalds.  They served the burger to me with McDonalds fries dumped on the plate.  Pretty poor.  They could be better since their location is great, but it leaves a lot to be desired.  Not recommended.

OOzPhZbtbunngPQwzD6bpA.text: I want to like this place, I really do. I've been here a few times before but sat at the bar and never ordered food, today I tried something new. When we entered, the hostess station was cluttered with cell phones and the blonde hair hostess was texting. We were seated outside, waited about 10 minutes before anyone came to our table. When we finally got service, he was a little slow and spent more time talking with two girls sitting at a hightop table than actually "working." He forgot refills on drinks   Never checked back once our food arrived. (His name is Chris). The Cuban sandwich was good but the fries were ice cold. Too bad Chris didn't come around so we could get new ones. Maybe we'll stick to the bar for service.

1Cxl5TBftzgT5Tmb1aC6kA.text: They have fantastic gluten free pizza, the best I've ever had eating out!  It's thick and  tastes like bread, or at least what I remember bread tasting like!  Way to go!  For all gluten free people in Pittsburgh, go here!!!! Very friendly wait staff as well! :-)

P9CuZ2gnjrfXiiwEq04VhA.text: Second visit to Social, and wanted to give it a second chance. This was worse than the first visit, and will definitely not be back, ever! too many great choices in Pittsburgh, and am glad to scratch this off my list!

9O-f6KnnzwzeQBXQEaLlTQ.text: I've been wanting to try this place since I saw it go in, so I went for happy hour with a friend. I got there quite early and sat at the bar; figured I would just have a drink until she got there.   I ordered a lemon drop martini--a favorite drink, and something that most bars can handle. I have no idea what the bartender put in this. I think it was sour mix and a very small amount of vodka, based on how incredibly sweet it was. The bartender asked if it was ok; I said it tasted awfully sweet so he kindly offered to add more lemon juice. He added quite a bit more "juice" from a container behind the bar and the drink tasted exactly the same--which is why I think it was sour mix. Oh well, I thought, I can stand to drink this and I'll switch to wine afterwards.   The bartender apologetically explained that he "is not a martini person" and left. Fine, I get that...but this isn't a complicated drink and *you are a bartender*.   I finished that drink and waited about ten minutes for the bartender to notice (again, at about 5pm on a Tuesday, when the bar was perhaps 1/4 full). He finally came over. I ordered a glass of wine. My friend texted to say she was finally on her way. Five minutes later, still no glass of wine in sight. I told her it wasn't worth coming and we met at Casbah instead.  I finally flagged down the bartender ten minutes after this. He seemed to have no recollection of my wine order so I paid and left. Definitely won't be back! The specials were...nothing special, and certainly didn't rival the many better happy hours in the Shadyside area.

rxTsSn-oZz3eDkFZXR4wyg.text: My boyfriend and I have been to social 3 times. bartenders were rude. Also, it seems reasonably priced.. till you get the bill.. for us.. i asked for no cheese, instead add tomato and i get charged money for the tomato... but no money off for the cheese.. honestly.. the bartender was really rude and that was so unfortunate because otherwise I may not have been compelled to write a review.  For each time we were there i could write a story.. the third time was ridiculous... the first 2 had us coming back for me because of happy hour and enjoyable food... well... i have lots of friends and i like to keep it real on yelp so its too bad for social.. :-( we're not going back

W3ieMeeoCb5Zi_0sC67ReA.text: Undecorated, bare block walls and concrete floor, echoing, droning acoustics and basement of a frat house feel.  The menu is sparse, boring, and the signature cocktails way over priced.  For a prime development like Bakery Square I expected much more.

a3BlGQlsE-OdaJKoHRj0aQ.text: I work near Bakery Square and was excited to hear a new restaurant was opening here.  I came here for lunch one day.  I ate outside on the patio.  I had the shrimp Po'boy  which was very good.  The menu looks intriguing with lots of different items on the menu.  Prices were fairly reasonably for a sit down restaurant.  They also have a nice happy hour with very reasonably priced drinks.

ak0WB-Q2A5I1Bv4eCv_zfg.text: Went here for dinner last night. Great special of $1.87 for a can if beer or cider. I ordered the woodchuck can to drink. Appetizer choices were different but we decided to be safe and order Luis' spicy chicken dip with half pita bread and half tortilla chips. It was just like a buffalo chicken dip but with a lot more cream cheese. We both created our own salads which were delicious and I was pleasantly surprised that my fried chicken was actually buffalo fried chicken. I would go back again and try something se. Salads are ok and can get boring

CsfGRU7L4X0l1IKa57Y22Q.text: Great place to hangout. My sis introduced me to this place last summer. I do have the say staff hasn't always been the friendliest but they are always crazy busy when I go. Service is usually pretty quick. All in all a good place to go.

6CZiRwteMgVpwvh2FlCdyw.text: I love that they have gf options listed. Also like the vegan options. Would recommend!  Also a plus that they have brunch just wish they had a vegan option.

lJe6ALetDuM-jxuB-94xuQ.text: Love the happy hour and small bites here! Summer Love (I think that's the name) is my favorite drinks and they all the bites to share (I shared them with two other people) were good. A step above most bars in terms of quality of food. Definitely worth trying.

mN_1t-viGkK6kkiRyELr9g.text: I've been here a few times, each time I order the same exact salad and each time it's one of the best salads I've ever had lol. I get mixed greens, spinach, grilled chicken, roasted red peppers, crouton, tomato, egg, red onion, and balsamic vinaigrette. I normally stick with water but I was in the mood for drinks, the drink was horrible. I can't remember the name of it but it tasted like cherry cough syrup. My friend ordered a specialty cocktail and hated that as well, it was something with basil or mint in it. She asked for something else, a margarita, and she didn't like that either. Definitely will stick with just getting food from here.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. MTO salad

eAWETQD-Dn7TG61wPauNMQ.text: This is hands down one of my favorite places in the city. They have a great beer selection and the food is amazing. You can even sit outside with your pups. I reccomend it to all my friends.

QIWgEa5jTeBp0es18BCKNA.text: If I was basing this on just the taste of my salad alone, it would be a solid 4 stars. But the service and wait time was beyond anything i've experienced recently. I've been a waitress when understaffed, but yikes. Were seated without menus, waited a good 15 minutes for someone to come over, and it got worse from there. My suggestion to others - do take-out!

8ep7qsxHygiAaWUkir6Eaw.text: I've now been to Social quite a few times now mostly for happy hour. My first visit was a reservation I made for a group of 20 in which I pre-ordered appetizers and drinks. The manager was a pleasure to work with and made everything super simple for me.   Happy hours are great here! I like how people are able to bring their dogs to sit outside. The waits are usually less than estimated. You can't beat $2 cans and drafts! I love the appetizers especially when half-price. Lots of breathing room to eat and mingle. There's darts if you're interested. The kale & artichoke duo as well as the tater tots are delicious and well worth the price. It's almost as if they fry and empty the entire bag onto your plate.

t8lbWbxV4brYIyp8K_FRSQ.text: Skip this joint! Major disappointment and huge miss!! Looks deceivingly cool & inviting from outside only to be immediately struck by how TGIF it looks inside and you end up asking yourself WTH instead?  Menu options and actual food is less than mediocre at best, which is surprising given how appetizing the rest of the area looks. Looks again can be deceiving.  Speaking of looks, my present company did not receive welcoming looks from management during our recent visit at this establishment and service was weird overall! Not worth the food, trip, neighborhood or price at all. They should be re-named Anti-Social instead!

XeBXIVrNioDOIh017IZbiA.text: Always a great place for dinner or happy hour--especially during the summer when you can sit outside! The food is always good and reasonably priced. Happy hour deals are great with $2-3 beers and half priced apps. Definitely try the spicy chicken dip and spinach dip! The salads are good, panini is good, and chicken and waffles sandwich is crazy good!! Servers are always knowledgeable and helpful. The triple threat: great food, drinks, and fun atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

BiTSAUwP3BLDW9ROvEGTyw.text: Pros: good service, food has always been good, our favorites are the turkey burger and margarita pizza. The salads are really great! Good happy hour specials. It's our go to, never disappointed. Always room in the garage to park.   Cons: loud, don't take reservations. The app doesn't always work, the receipts barcode never seems to work.   Wish list: A better variety of sports (not just basketball, football & baseball) Reservations, live music outside would be fun!

mhM3rd9Kjc835cKucuzPxg.text: This is great place to go. We are from Slippery Rock, Pa, and make their trip every couple months. The service is excellent, and food is too! Highly recommend this place!!!!!!

WoywW9YJqCGovI-2XlAdEg.text: Came here for brunch with my girlfriends. No problem getting a table and we were seated right away. Half priced mimosas on Saturdays which was a nice surprise, but still $4 even half off. Generous size of the drink, though. I like that the mugs of coffee were large too.   The waitress was attentive and made sure our water and coffee was topped off.  I ordered the scramble and it was fine. It had too much cheese for my taste and made it a little too heavy, but the portion was generous. The wheat toast was served a little burnt and hard, and we had to ask for butter. Not sure who eats dry toast with breakfast! It also came with tater tots, which were just normal.  Overall, social is a safe choice because of their large dining room and available parking lot. Nothing too crazy to write home about either way, better during the weekdays for their happy hour specials.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

EAExXdTvYzMGbkdzm9i4Gg.text: Without a doubt, Social is one of my favorite places in Pittsburgh! With a great location in Bakery Square and a wonderful variety of food and drinks, what's not to love?! Their happy hour features a long list of $2 and $3 beer and half off appetizers! Some of the "must try" options are their nachos, buffalo chicken dip, and fries.  They offer a merlot blue cheese to dip the fries in that is AMAZING and I cannot go without. In the summer, their outside patio is lit up and a wonderful atmosphere, and inside is fun, too. My only concern is sometimes service has been very slow/inattentive.  However, don't let that steer you away!   PRO TIP: 3 FREE hours of parking in the Bakery Square parking garage!

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nachos and beer on happy hour

85fayWDDQ6NRtiHYYoJjzQ.text: Cool bar with an interesting menu. I got the grilled chicken blt which is good as are the fries. Gluten free bun is extra $2 so no thank you. Large draft selection is good for hanging out or coming to watch sports on their tvs. Also they have darts!  Brunch on Sunday has half off bloody Mary's and goes until 3. Pop music usually plays in the background.   Parking is free in the garage and there is decent outdoor seating too. If you park in the regular lot be careful of the parking monitors that will ticket you!

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. gcblt mmhmmmm
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Darts, tv, foosball

cD-oNJ44rN6td-3I7oA9Aw.text: Hands down the worst veggie burger I've ever had (and to be fair most bars have good veggie burgers these days). It was deep fried in old oil and had a rancid taste. This place isn't even worth the relatively cheap prices. There are so many great sports in Pittsburgh and this isn't one of them. I wish the location was used for something better.   I'm sure it is fine for a beer, because beer is always good.

I_ajnp11O4rUfSjzpoVpRg.text: After a great Yelp Elite event at the Frick, we were a little hungry so of course we checked Yelp for restaurants in the area. We were going to stop for coffee in Bakery Square but saw Social do we thought we'd give it a try. It was ok, bar food and feel. We sat outside which is nice. Ordered a turkey sandwich and I order the French Onion soup. The sandwich order came on 2 plates because our waitress thought we were sharing. Nope! Never even mentioned sharing. After a few minutes of not receiving my soup I asked her and she forgot put in the order! I think she even wrote it down. When it finally came it was hot but served in a very small bowl. I'd call it more of a cup. The croutons were garlic which is different. It was hot when I finally received it.

BE-ggT12Qx2_JbRQwgjajA.text: My new go to in Pittsburgh. Their chicken wings are confit and perfect. Love the fact that they don't skimp on blue cheese or celery. Great beer selection. Smack yo momma good!

2hrPcYBzrB8irMrFv-mqvQ.text: This place gets an F'n 'F'. Booooo  Mostly everything is eat n Park quality and beers are REALLY expensive.   Just another example of groups with money who stink at making food, but can afford prime real estate and a liqueur license.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ziOgbSXlpucQ9uLtDBElkA.text: I've visited here twice and will admit that while my boyfriend loves this restaurant...I just don't.  The food is okay, nothing I personally super enjoy (but he does, so this is based on personal preference).  The waiters and waitresses have always been kind to us and the atmosphere is pretty cool - but it just seems like there is something missing.  The price of the food is more than I would like to pay for the taste/quality, but I'm optimistic because it really is a great location and set up.  I will definitely be back and hope that things change up a bit!

s8yVRqA-HZJzP-VGrv3NLA.text: Always a good meal. Love the cauliflower cakes, they're aggressively simple (some may say plain or boring) but I think it's part of what makes them so delicious. Also loveee the mushroom truffle pizza. Been multiple times with families and friends, it's not a show stopping culinary experience, but everything is delicious and fresh, in that it's not played out American bar food. Hip, flavorful, and interesting menu. Always a Hit when I go!!

7S9DMQGbd8m-g-6G7lI1-w.text: I absolutely love Social. Their salads are amazing and really filling. Burgers are great and their large pizza is huge. Social has a great variety for people who are gluten free. Highly recommended.

txfa4JZFh4bpZhC3ZFb27A.text: This food is amazing. It's always so fresh. The turkey burger has so much flavor. The staff is so friendly, the genuine friendliness not fake. I have now been here four times and it keeps getting better. I highly recommend coming to try their food.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Best turkey burger on the planet.
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tons of decisions?

PTmkQM6y7HC8aCG6vszRWQ.text: Having come to "sh@* can" beer night (Wednesday) every night for the past 5 weeks, I have grown fond of coming to Social. On this night, nearly all of the beers are priced at $2 or $3 and the selection is pretty good. The waitstaff can be slow and forgetful sometimes, but always very outgoing, friendly, and apologetic. The food is decent as well, particularly their build-your-own salads. However, there is one factor every Wednesday night which every potential Social-goer should be aware of, the dart league. Every sh@* can night, about 20 of the most impolite people in Pittsburgh swarm over half of the bar like a bunch of gnats seeking rotten fruit. I am a fan of participating in bar sports myself, but one must be aware that there is certain etiquette to abide by whilst playing games, or doing anything else, in the presence of other people. These pathetic, ignorant lowlifes pour their heart and soul into throwing objects at a board, carelessly stampeding and shouting around the bar like they own the place. I've seen them slamming barstools and glasses, standing over other patrons' tables while they're eating or trying to watch the tvs hung above the bar, and I saw one guy scream in the ear of a +80 year old woman, making her cry, because one of them hit a double 18. This unkept, careless faction of the bar practices reprehensible behavior every Wednesday night and I highly recommend sitting on the other side of the bar, if you even go at all. Do yourself a favor and avoid it at all costs.. at least until Social does something about these awful people. Otherwise, Social would be a great place to eat, drink, and socialize.

7yJxblSaSBnbt3-qtWKCrQ.text: I wasn't sure what to expect based on the mixed reviews, but I'm happy to say my expectations were surpassed!  The space is a bit industrial, but also very open and conducive to socializing.  The menu has fun "prompts" written along the top in case you need a little help getting the conversation started.  Or you could go with my preferred method of social lubrication, alcohol, and get yourself a drink from the fully stocked bar.  Your choice.  The menu is standard bar food, kicked up a notch and freshened up a bit.  Instead of plain ol' nachos and cheese, they're serving up a delicious app of ahi tuna nachos, complete with guac, wasabi, and sriracha.  Be aware: this dish comes pre-portion controlled, aka you get five nachos, individually topped with an appropriate amount of ahi tuna and guac.  This is a good thing, because you'll have plenty of room to enjoy your main course.  I went with a salad known as "The Beet", a lovely combo of arugula, goat cheese, walnuts, roasted beets, green apple, and orange walnut dressing.  From looking back at the menu, I also noticed that this salad contained an item known as "roasted reds". I cannot recall what the "roasted reds" were, I may need to go back and investigate. But I digress.  Mystery item or not, the salad was tasty.  For all you picky salad eaters out there, Social offers a "Social Market" option, where you can use a little mini golf pencil and a checklist to create your own salad.  Perfect for when you're feeling particularly persnickety.  Finally, the drinks.  I was sticking with plain old water on this trip, but I did stare longingly at at the pitcher of sangria across the bar.  They've got a small but diverse wine list, some interesting cocktails, and a few "social mixers" that can be ordered by the pitcher.  They also have a blackboard of seasonal drafts and a large selection of canned beers.  Be sure to check out the daily specials, "Martini Monday", "2 for 1 Tuesday" etc. for deals.

9R95VenQF6sJ8-EMqLQJLQ.text: Went here for dinner on a Saturday night. Was pleased to see their appetizers are half off from 5-7pm throughout the whole restaurant, even on a Saturday. We got a French Dip Sandwich and Chicken and Waffles Sandwich. Both were underwhelming. The french dip meat and bun was good and a large portion, but they put greens on the sandwich which I felt made it worse. We both hated the chicken & waffle, even though we typically love the combo. It was really small, especially for being the most expensive sandwich on the menu ($13). The waffle was like deep fried in butter and a premade breaded chicken patty. Meh.

bmpHsOBTzP48nwNj3mzkCA.text: I have always liked social. It's great to have a local place for good food and drinks aside from shadyside, which tends to drawl a young crowd.  The food is very consistent. It always seems fresh and I think the price is fitting (maybe a tad over).  The cauliflower patties and kale and shrimp salad are my favorites. I think the main downfall of this place is the decor. They could do a lot to make it look less drab.

-Tg9BfTR2HCcrpLw3sz1qg.text: Great staff, good atmosphere, the food has room for improvement.  Aioli was bland, the grilled cheese was essentially cheese-less, and there was cheese in my fiancee's wrap, despite specifying (lactose allergy).  The staff was genuinely concerned, though, and the pizza and guacamole were pretty good.  The wrap was great the second time around.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Social, on Penn Avenue

b2Z18id3Tvkx2iIrEboXfw.text: Awesome food. I love the atmosphere. Wasn't sure what to expect when they announced it was going in, but they've exceeded my expectations. My favorites so far are the cauliflower bites and the meatball sliders.   They also have some sweet high tech additions to the bar including charging ports below the bar for your phone, a jukebox you can control from your phone, and dartboards that allow you to play against someone across the world. Cool place.   The owners are cool too, very friendly and awesome. I work across the street and it's great to have the smell of a burger cooking outside once and a while!

X8mb82DQeNjSoAveXgOvzA.text: Mixed feelings: if you are going here to drink you are okay. .nice open bar, outdoor seating,  trendy area..the food on the other hand is probably only good if you are drunk. Very bland, poor quality, cheap meat, can mushrooms, watery chili, flavorless cheese. Black bean quesadilla is just a can of black beans with no seasoning inside a chared tortilla..beans were cold. Not served with salsa or sour cream....plus I think they stole the layout and theme of Burgatory. You can customize a salad, however it will cost you about $20 for toppings on it. on the plus or minus side, depending on preference you can bring your dog. we were sat at an outdoor table next to three dogs, we asked to move, kind of annoying. overall if you want a fun place to drink this is ok, but don't go for the food.

I3HJlnMJXRu0ud_PGw4sTg.text: I loved this place! I heard my cousin rave about the Thai Chicken pizza so I just had to try it. We meet up for lunch there but unfortunately they took the thai chicken pizza off the menu. Boo!!! Bring it back!!!!! We ordered the BBQ chicken pizza and it was delicious! Social is in the up and coming Bakery Square so parking was a little hard to find. I cant wait to go back to try more.

aqpM0TvCbB2gSiZ7X-hxrA.text: Everything went well with the food and drinks. At the end, we were charged the incorrect price for a beer due to the server putting in the drink order 2 minutes before happy hour. Some of us in my party were charged the happy hour rate and some were not, even though we all ordered at the same time. After informing our server and subsequently the manager, the manager passive agressively threatened to remove the happy hour discount from everyone's bill.  It was a real shame that a great meal ended this way because it ruined the evening for my friends and I. Unfortunately, we will not be back.

z1pBkL3vK2KslH40f-0XZw.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Shadyside and I go all the time! Love the $2 cans of beer and the food is delicious. Although a bit pricy, I don't mind going here because I know I'll always have a good time. The atmosphere is super fun - indoor or outdoor seating, bar, big TVs, corn hole, ping pong tables, people bring dogs - it's great. (also kid friendly)  As far as food, my regular is the grilled cheese with orzo as a side - really good! I've also had the cauliflower patties, pizza, and brunch. All great!

jt731yMmMMuoUxto2-IoBw.text: This restaurant has the rudest manager ever. We had a coupon that they sent us a week or so ago on the LoyalTree app. When our server said he wouldn't honor it, the manager came out and told us we were using the wrong app (even though they sent us a coupon in this app). He didn't know the name of the correct app though and refused to honor our coupon and just kept saying he would give us the coupon if we downloaded the app (which he didn't know the name of). He just kept telling us he didn't know how the app works because he "doesn't do coupons" even though he is the manager of the restaurant that gave us a coupon. Eventually another server came over and set the record straight and we got our discount but this experience completely ruined Social for us. We've been there a bunch of times in the past since we live near by but we will never be going back. Previous experiences were that the food and service was OK, maybe 3.5 stars on average.  That's down to one star now due to a Manger who didn't know how their own app works and who literally yelled at customers in the restaurant.

3cjMJ9mRut26ngyp5qLPng.text: We came in and were sat near a children's birthday party. Here were kids running around screaming. After not having a server come to our table after five minutes we left. Nome of the staff appeared to care, even after we informed them of the situation.

201GJydrdaXo7CgfxeYJHA.text: While I'm not a huge fan of Social's food, this is the place to head on Saturday's and Sunday's when mimosas (Saturday) and bloody Mary's (Sunday) are half off their regular price. In addition to the traditional orange juice mimosa, they offer cranberry and apple. Bloody Mary's, although traditional, are not weak by any means and are served with a couple garnishments. Give them a try on an upcoming weekend.

7k9NloMrd6O5QcUX_SsSeQ.text: Hmmmmm....well meaning servers giving poor service. Er...management issues.  They're trying to do something awesome with swappi g lentils for fries and Penn's in the background but it's not for me.  Don't take my review as a reason to not eat here because it is hopping. Maybe all the folks here know something I missed.  Enjoy!

1IA2cX6G2DO_nOVA_Q8f4g.text: I really had high hopes for this restaurant but that all ended after waiting 45 minutes for a salad and fries. The waitress at the bar was horrible. When I reached the bar, there was no one on the side that I was sitting on. I waited about 5 minutes before the waitress even greeted me. She asked if she could help me and I told her I never received a menu. After asking about vegan options, I decided to just use the create your own salad feature. It took another 15 minutes for her to even come and grab my slip, after walking past me at least 5 times, taking other people's orders. At this point there are at least 6 others on my side. They are receiving appetizers and meals and yet I still hadn't received my salad and fries, which was a to go order. She finally brings my bag of food over, which apparently had been sitting there for quite a bit. I pay my tab & she brings me back the wrong amount of change. I wait a few more minutes and then I had to basically yell for her attention. I started to ask for a manager but I decided to write this review instead. I will never go back there. Oh and my fries were awful.

goBNd-EqfB_-yoPmiVxWfQ.text: The atmosphere is really nice and I really liked the beer selection. I just feel that it was really unprofessional for the bartenders to drink while working.  If your not sober while working then how can you expect to look after your customers?

rankKC7RjO4Csb_RoUGP-A.text: Great place for drinks if you're staying at Bakery Square. We went on Friday, which was half price bottles of wine night. It was excellent. The hot chicken dip was a decent app.

tgsUO6qam9jBjqpzy-_Tqg.text: I usually like this place but our waitress  was one of those people who shouldn't be in the business of pleasing others. .. She was unfortunately just rude to us about multiple things we inquired about.  Otherwise decent beers (not a hugee selectiom) and the food is pretty good. They have a nice large outdoor seating area in the front, and trivia on Mondays.

rNta_GVVBsBXYccg6eJpvA.text: I heard Social had a nice patio space so what a perfect place to dine on a night like last night! We sat at one of the bar tops around the edge of the patio. We were quickly greeted by Aubrey (?) who started us off with 2 beers (a 21st amendment IPA for my boyfriend and a Slyfox 113 IPA for me) and waters. Just FYI, pretty sure they have only cans and a few draft selections-no bottles. Friday was half price bottles of wine but we both stuck to beers. The menu I'd classify as "new American"-pizzas,salads,sandwiches,etc. My boyfriend started off with the soup of the day-a chilled squash soup with basil and creme freche. I had only a spoonful but can report it was yummy. A great cold soup for a warm summer evening! For entrees, I ordered the cheesy bacon grilled cheese on white. It came with a side,of which I chose the side salad with jalepeno lime dressing. The grilled cheese was apple bacon and some gouda. It was tasty but the bread overwhelmed the ingredients. I felt there should have either been less bread or more ingredients. The salad was a standard salad but the dressing was excellent-had a spicy kick naturally, being jalepeno dressing. My boyfriend had the Cuban sandwich with fries. On the Cuban was swiss,pork,capicola,pickles,and Dijon. He said it was very tasty but did not resemble a "typical" Cuban. I noticed a lot of tables had pizzas and they smelled delicious so I'd love to go back and try a pizza. It was not too loud outside at all and our service was good so really no complaints on our dining experience!

r3mNkXurNW0YUsV9PT-0Bw.text: I wasn't expecting anything special given the quality of reviews here, but I was pleasantly surprised! It's not anything gourmet, but my sister and I had a very pleasant time having dinner here.   It was a nice cool evening when we came so we decided to sit at one of the outside tables - a very cute little area to sit and chat, and the tables aren't too close together for comfort. Bakery Square is pretty adorable, with kids nearby playing ping pong and people enjoying the patio with their dogs.   I ordered the classic pierogies for a starter; this was the least impressive part of my meal. I'm from Buffalo, so I was interested to compare the pierogies here to those at home, with both cities having such significant Polish populations. Unfortunately based on this sample, Buffalo definitely wins - these were decently tasty, but more or less had the quality of something that you could get out of a box in the freezer section of the grocery store (still though, how much can you really mess up dough filled with potatoes and cheese!). Also were way too drenched in butter, to the point of leaving our lips feeling greasy.  I'm pleased to report that the entrees went over much better. I had a Reuben sandwich, which was delicious. Really loaded up with corned beef, and the flavors of the meat, kraut, and sauce melded in a really pleasant and tangy way. The French fries were also above average quality, for this type of casual restaurant. My sister was similarly pleased with her Buffalo chicken sandwich.   Overall, would be happy to return here on my next visit to Pittsburgh, and could see myself hanging out here often with friends due to the casual, low key atmosphere and solid quality of the food at a decent price.

3KS4kgzhTP-weCZP0yxhHg.text: TL/DR : Social is : a GREAT place for groups, a great place for a drink, and a good place for food after said drink. But it's not .... the best .... if you are there to have a meal that is quality in a quiet or even medium noise level space. If you are allergic to dogs sit inside! They DO allow dogs on their porch which is awesome  It's a good place to watch the game with friends and just an all around welcoming place that could use some tweaks on the front end of service   I deducted two stars due to quality of food and service.   Social, it's a place I walk by or ride by nearly everyday. And yet it took me months to get there. My date and I chose this place because it was convenient. It was trivia night (Monday night!) so not to knock trivia but we wanted to sit outside to avoid the noise. Trivia night is pretty loud.   When we asked for outdoor seating they were accommodating, until I asked to be seated fully under the covering; and the hostess wanted to know why. I had to quickly make a reason up, that she found sufficient, so we could be moved.   The noise outside wasn't much better. And legit everyone had a dog. I'm a HUGE dog lover; but if you are afraid of dogs or allergic this might not be the place for you (outside at least! ).   So right now I'm taking one star away -- for the hostess experience -- it wasn't accommodating and I felt unnerved that they asked why we wanted to switch to a table that wasn't in the sun.   Onto the food. The fries are good! Really good. Get those. I had the veggie burger and it was cold / tasted like it had maybe come from an expensive box. It was dry and if I wasn't really hungry I wouldn't have eaten it at all. My date had the turkey club and he couldn't eat it. I had to take a star off for food quality.  Our server was nice but it took forever to get the check.  The bill for drinks, apps, and two dinners was only $35! as well . look forward to going back; but not on trivia night and I won't get that veggie burger again haha!

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie Burger
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie Burger

Gjv2f6mjYUXTsIpbLd2l3A.text: I really wanted to like Social because it's in a great location and it's close to my apartment.. This being said it didn't meet my expectations. My sister and I split the Mac and Beer Cheese, Pretzels with beer cheese (not mustard), and the Buffalo Chicken Pizza.   To say the least, everything was extremely bland and honestly mediocre. We personally were not a fan of the Mac and Beer Cheese. The Buffalo Chicken Pizza tasted extremely bland - I totally wasn't expecting this because it looked so good!! Our favorite item we tried were the Pretzels (we decided to get them with beer cheese instead of mustard). Again, the pretzels were pretty basic with nothing special to them. Our favorite part was the beer cheese dip, which was the only item that really stood out to us.   I probably would've given this place 2 stars based strictly on the food, but thanks to the lively and fun atmosphere it receives 3 stars from me!  If I decide to come here again, it'll probably just be to grab a drink and enjoy the atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pretzel Stick with Beer Cheese
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo 2.0 Pizza
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mac &amp; Beer Cheese

9yUvJv20IUee_cU2MQEg8A.text: Social is the host of PSL cornhole league so I come here every Tuesday for the game. They have a pretty good happy hour with $3 select beers and drink specials per day. What I'm impressed with is half off ALL apps during happy hour. It gives you the opportunity to try a bunch of different items. I've tried the Irish nachos, the general tso cauliflower, the guapo tacos, and the pretzel sticks. I think the general tso and the nachos were my fav. The guapo tacos are *spicy* so if you don't like spice make sure to ask for the sauce on the side!

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. General Tso&#39;s Cauliflower

tojEmnGN_cpwATnFdz8oAw.text: This place is a great bar/restaurant located in the happening area of Bakery Square/East Liberty! The food is great (I love the Pittsburgh salad) and the atmosphere is very relaxed, with TV's and music in the background. They have additional seating on their covered outdoor patio, making this a great spot for all seasons. Staff is always very friendly!

iwI2yf1KH03a23nsl6tJiw.text: If you have hours to kill and enjoy waiving a server down anytime you need something, then this is the place for you.  Their food is typical bar food, or maybe a little worse. The chicken on my salad was chewy, so I made one final attempt to save this experience by ordering an ice cream cookie...let's just say their "happy ending" did not deliver.  If I had to say something nice, it'd be that it's in a good location and has outdoor seating when it's that time.  In all seriousness though, I would not recommend going here & will not be going back.

zpZRsGpKlVXbV4FrDRXLxA.text: I stopped here because I had a little time to kill before a meeting. I thought I would get a drink and an appetizer. The place was half empty but service was super slow. When my items finally arrived, my beer was nice and the soft pretzel sticks with beer cheese were enjoyable. Then there was more waiting, for the check. I'll only go back when I have a LOT of time on my hands to sit and wait.

saCVloZSRwbK-GRHWJIT8A.text: This restaurant is very inconsistent. I've been here a couple of times now, and the food is always pretty good, however the wait staff varies.  In terms of food, they used to have a kale and artichoke dip which was outstanding, but when we went a few days ago, it was spinach and artichoke dip. I'm sure it's still amazing though. The first time I went there, I made my own salad with falafel, goat cheese, apples, and walnuts and it was absolutely incredible. Recently when we went, I got the gluten free mushroom bianca pizza. It was lacking seasoning and a whole salad basically came on top of my pizza, but it was still alright. The crust itself was delicious for it being gluten free. My boyfriend got the buffalo chicken pizza, and the rest of my family got sandwiches which they all said were delicious. The fries however were way overdone and again, lacked seasoning.  The drink selection here is amazing! I recommend either getting a moscow mule or a salty dog cocktail because they were phenomenal and STRONG!   We had a little problem with out waitress though. My dad asked for tator tots, which he did not get, and was still charged extra for them. We paid it anyway because it was a dollar, but still, we paid a dollar extra for food he did not get. Additionally, the waitress came around several times, but never asked if we wanted any more drinks or anything like that. I don't know if it was an off day or if she was new, but still.  Overall, I'd say go here if you're looking to grab great apps and watch sports and have good drinks.

5QYQCm8E-g8Pe7n09VIQYA.text: So me and my friend just got here at 7:30pm and the hostess told us that they aren't seating anyone for the rest of the night???   But the kitchen is opened until 11pm daily???  Excuse me?  Guess this is what happens when East Liberty becomes Bakery Square...  Won't be coming back... think of a better lie next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

5ZQMBh69BcRh8aoFjx3dSQ.text: Extremely disappointing. I ended up with a terrible stomachache and nausea after eating at Social. The food and service were very bad too.  First, I ordered the grilled mushroom panini on gluten free bread and added grilled chicken to it. I also got a side of tater tots instead of french fries. The panini, as listed on the menu, had grilled mushrooms, roasted tomatoes, goat cheese, and arugula pesto on it. In reality, there was only like one tiny mushroom in the entire panini. There was hardly any grilled chicken, so  I was baffled by the upcharge for it since they don't even add that much in the panini. The arugula pesto did not taste like pesto at all, it was bland and just tasted like they threw some arugula in a food processor and called it a day. The "roasted tomatoes" tasted like those crappy sundried tomatoes you buy at Giant Eagle. Once again, they only threw one little "roasted" tomato in the entire panini. A complete waste of 17 dollars.   A few hours later, I end up with a terrible stomachache and nausea, to the point where I almost threw up. I was up all night with this terrible stomachache. A day later and I'm bloated like a pufferfish. I'm guessing it's the "gluten free" bread they used to make my panini. Because the bread they used did not even look like gluten free bread- I've been gluten free all of my life so I'm smart enough to know what the different types of gluten free bread look like and taste like. Gluten free bread is typically grainy, dense, and has a lot of seeds (think chia or flax) in it. The bread I had was not like this at all, but that doesn't mean it was good- it was stale.   Finally, the service was horrible. My waiter would disappear and I kept having to flag him down. At one point, I had to get another waiter to go get my original waiter. I understand that waiters are busy and have other tables to take care of, but please, don't disappear from your customers and not come back!   My fellow gluten free friends, please do not go to Social unless you want to be on the toilet all day/night long. But in general, the food here is poor quality and the service is poor. I'm not one to give harsh, 1-star reviews like this review, but in this case, I felt the need to. I can't believe I dropped almost 20 dollars on a sandwich that tasted like garbage. Definitely not coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled mushroom panini on gluten free bread with a side of tater tots

1r9s1hkbmIAijtovDly2CQ.text: My friend and I went here last night. We shared a bottle of rose which was half priced - which was nice and relatively cheap - $9 for each of us. We did the build your own salads. Overall it wasn't bad I felt like I didn't get a lot of protein and there was an over abundance of lettuce. My pita bread I ordered was over cooked making it really hard to chew.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Y4D-eBfwEbmqX4mRadSizw.text: Compared to most bars and pubs, Social's food is really great. Compared to a regular restaurant, the food tends to be a little lackluster.  That being said, Social is a solid choice for Happy Hours and work lunches, with plenty of food and drink options to keep everyone happy.  I appreciate their ability to accommodate a gluten free dietary restriction, especially given how bread- and flour-heavy bar food can end up being. The gluten free options are plentiful, and their gluten free buns are really fantastic. I actually had to double check the first time I had a burger to make sure the bun was actually gluten free.  Overall, the food is decent, and great for when you're looking for a burger or some wings, but the atmosphere can be very loud and unpleasant depending on the time. I came for lunch with a friend and it was already borderline too loud for a normal conversation. I will definitely return when I get the hankering for a burger or some tater tots.

vS2xS5lkg0ayauaQW6EiNA.text: The food is really good at Social. I heard there have been just 2 executive chefs here since it opened, perhaps the reason why the food has been consistently excellent.   Prices are reasonable, especially given the quality.   It's a good place to watch a game, although the screens can also be a bit intrusive, unless you are seated outside.  The wait staff is attentive, and they know the menu well and are able to make good suggestions.   I like the craft beer selection, especially the East End Big Hop.   Another bonus is the abundance of vegetarian options.  Pizzas are first rate.   All in all, a really comfortable place to go with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tomato soup
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie Quesadilla
Photo of Social - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French Onion Soup and Cheese and Egg

0La-cvYbdvcPavYrgOR1zw.text: I have been to Social several times now. Today we went on our way home from daycare. From 5-7 they have happy hour and you get half off appetizers. We ordered the cauliflower patties off the appetizer menu. We didn't realize we would get 4 patties! They were really good and I'm glad there were some left to bring home.  For our entrees we ordered the chicken and waffles and the mushroom panini. My panini was just okay, nothing to write home about but wasn't bad by any means. My husbands chicken and waffles were really good.  I think Social is fair in price but you have to go for that happy hour deal. They have a nice outdoor area to sit in which we took advantage of. Perfect for summer days.  We parked in the garage which is free for your first 3 hours. We will be back again and most likely for happy hour!

feNfte1Lzzqj13tVJBjJog.text: Visit Bakery Place and Visit Social for dinners and family/ group events, Game days and Social gatherings. Place is  cool and happening welcoming.   Dogs are welcome for outdoor seating. It will be heated during winters.  Prawyn's Score Card  Location  - 8/10 (Great spot, Over the road, Easy get on and get off) Parking - 8/10 ( Street parking, public garage parking, No Valet service) Menu Options - 8/10 ( Custom made per your taste, great Drinks and Beers) Service Quality - 7/10 ( Prompt & Courteous )  Value for money - 8/10 ($ menu ) Seating Comfort -  7/10 (non cushioned, Indoor & Outdoor) Noise Level - 9/10 ( 10 Being High ) Cleanliness - 7/10 ( Overall Tidy, ok-ok Restrooms)
